[h1]If Spore grew up into a shallow, space-themed, open-world sandbox, with MMO-like grind[/h1]

If you have had the pleasure of playing Maxis' 2008 hit game, Spore - this game is the spiritual successor. Everything from trying to fly your spaceship to the center of the galaxy, exploring randomly generated worlds and ecosystems, to the casual combat feel. 

[u]The problem is, the universe of No Man's Sky is very shallow and repetitive, inspite of all its procedurally generation.[/u] What I mean by that, is that while the core gameplay loop (explore -> gather -> upgrade -> repeat) can be very enjoyable, [u]there is a lack of depth and variety in the gameplay.[/u]

If you are planning to get into this game, I hope you will go in with the expectations of a janky indy-project, more than a AAA blockbuster title or anything.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Lack of Depth[/h1]

Like Spore in the space stage, the gameplay is straightforward. First, you will learn how to survive in the environment, gathering resources to fix your spacesuit and tool. Then you are left to learn about the different ways of gathering resource / making money / fighting different enemies... and that's all there is to the game.

Different worlds will have different hazards (cold/heat/radiation/acid/water) but these provides almost no difference in gameplay. You just get a different colored damage bar that you will have to refill with the same resource occasionally... Even the most basic of gameplay change, like having your laser gun overheat at different speed depending on the planet temperature, is not part of this game. Every planet also have the same gravity, every planet is a terrestrial world (no gas giants!?) and there is no exploration off-planets.

You will need to gather a variety of resources and recipes to make your life easier; but in the end, all you get is just a bigger number. No gameplay change, no interesting tradeoff in upgrades, just, finding gears with bigger number and more slots.

The alien interactions are also lacking. Though NMS tried to build a sense of mystery by having you learn the languages (literally word-by-word!), it is functionally meaningless. You can still trade and get along just fine without learning a single word.
While some encounters may prompt you to read in the alien's language, getting the answer right provides meager rewards in the long run. You can get along just fine without them, and getting those rewards only help you minimally, mostly in the early game.

[h1]Lack of Variety[/h1]

The game is extremely repetitive. You will see it, even on your first planet. 

Each world is just red/green/blue hills. The "hazards" are just different colored damage bars. Acid is green, heat is red, cold is blue, and radiation is yellow. All planets have the same gravity, just different size. No gas giants or any other interesting celestial bodies to explore. You can't even get out of your ship off-planet (and outside of space stations). Like, what do you mean I can't go and explore the asteroid belts? What do you mean I can't even fly into the sun if I wanted to!? 

The different "encounters" are repeatedly copy-pasted over and over. Cargo drops? You'll find them everywhere. Crashed ship? Same shape, same cargo, same gameplay. Artifact digs? I hope you liked the toy where you dig dinosaur bones out of clay, because this is literally all you do. Not even the positions in each encounters are randomized. It's just land, go to the same location, do the same thing, lift off, and repeat.

The missions are also just cheaply randomized go here, do this, shoot that. Alien relationship means nothing, and you just spam "learn dialect" to get yet another word then walk away. Even Spore Galactic Adventures, a game from 2009, had more gameplay variety than this game.

Which brings me to the next issue...

[h1]The Grind[/h1]

This game becomes all about grind. Go shoot that tree to get this resource, fly there and get that upgrade, repeatedly do capitalist things until you have enough money to buy a frigate that can carry all your stuff. Then go to the center of the galaxy I guess.

I'm already sinking almost 40 hours into this game, and I've been repeatedly doing the same thing over and over and over... And I really want to recommend this game, but I just can't.

[h1]The Jank[/h1]

And to wrap all this up nicely, the game is very "jank".

[u]The keyboard and mouse control scheme is probably the worst I have ever seen.[/u] It is very clear that this game was designed for controller first, and the keyboard and mouse controls were added later by someone who has never played on a PC. From the moment I booted up the game and got greeted with a "hold left mouse to press button", I knew I was in for a ride. Somehow, NMS devs has managed to make a control scheme that requires too many buttons, and also too deeply nested within its own submenus. I learnt the controls within about a day of playing, but the learning phase was absolutely infuriating.

The game is still also very buggy, [u]TEN YEARS[/u] after the game's 2013 VGX premiere. You will find generated cargo drops and plants floating / clipping into each other. The way procedural generation works is also very jank, as you will constantly find mountains and buildings fade in-out of existence while you are flying over a planet. Oh, and did I mention that your game will crash if you try to use its built-in screenshot function? Yeah, that's [i]still[/i] a thing.

[h1]Closing Thoughts[/h1]

> I love all the base-builder/sandbox games from Sim City to Minecraft, where I enjoy doing whatever the hell I pleased, without needing "objectives" to do. But No Man's Sky just doesn't have as much depth as those games.

> I love all the grindy JRPGs where I repeatedly hit different colored slime with my bigger number sticks, where I eventually get to watch the story unfold. But No Man's Sky doesn't have as compelling a narrative like those games either.

> I loved the original Spore for its carefree exploration of the universe. But No Man's Sky delivers that with jank lipservice, failing to provide anything actually interesting to explore or see, and in a completely unimmersive way.

I myself am a complete sucker for this type of games, and I really wanted to love and recommend No Man's Sky, but I just can't. I'll probably grind it just for completion, but nothing more. Spore did it better.
space

64 hours on PC - 500+ on console.
Did this game have a big poopoo launch with thousands of memes, 100% yes!
Did the developers knuckle down and work hard to update and update and update and update into one of the greatest games I've ever played since then, 300% yes!!

We all know the developers could have taken that money from launch and just ran with it, but I have huge respect for the commitment they put into the title post launch and the pride they take in the game.

This game isn't perfect, but it feels good supporting a developer that stood by and continued to grow their game for 7 years and still going and I always enjoy popping in
Keeps getting better and better.  Been playing since the initial release and have never needed to shell out another penny for all of the upgrades.  Good job guys!
Nobody will read my review, so I'll just say i'm gay.
I pirated the game in 2016, then bought it on Steam in 2019, and bought it on PS4 in 2021. They deserved every penny that I have throughout the years!!
Excellent execution on moving this game to Mac. The support for MetalFX and the Apple Silicon has been spot on for me.

Wow... Just... Wow...

I never played NMS when all the negativity was plaguing the game, but after it started taking off I dabbled here and there. I finally dove in a few months ago just to see if I would enjoy it. This is THE space survival game, no other game even comes close. If you're into survival games that is this is an absolute treasure. Not to mention the fact that they haven't done the whole Paradox thing and released 50 DLC at this point, all content has been free.

My ONE complaint, and it's probably just because I haven't spent enough time in the game. Is the whole "Expedition" mechanic. If you're familiar with Seasons from other big MMOs it's of the similar vein. I'm just not sure if "I" find them fun, doesn't mean that you wont of course.

As far as price goes, 60$ is a pretty steep cost. I personally try to buy everything on sale and rarely buy games at full price. The amount of content in this game though is easily more than your average two AAA combined, maybe even three.
u can do the star wars hyperspace traveling STONKS
This is one of the best games I've ever played. If you like games where you collect resources, build a base, etc... (Ark, Rust, etc...) and you love sci-fi then this game is for you!
Only criticism i have is the unintuitive star map navigation

Buy it when it's on sale for half off to get your money's worth. It's a good time sink, but the content lacks real variety and the combat is pretty sad. It's very easy to become nearly invincible. The only point of the multiple galaxies full of planets seems to be a size contest with Elite Dangerous or something, since they get really repetitive, really fast. The main mission storyline is pretty good if a bit predictable for the attentive. The refinery is your friend - look up the recipes because they make no real world logical sense.
spotted a giant underground centipede thing. this game is awesome
It is simply a MUST BUY for every space exploration enthusiast. Cant get enough of it. BADASS SEAL OF APPROVEMENT!
Fantastic game. The port to MacOS run great!

applist.name: DayZ
applist.detailed_description:
Join our Discord


About the Game

This is your Story


There are no map markers, daily quests, or scoreboards to help you create your story. There is only Chernarus – 230 square kilometers of post-Soviet country that was struck by an unknown virus, which turned the majority of its population into raging infected.

Your task? To survive the collapse of civilization for as long as you possibly can. Keep in mind that death is permanent in unforgiving Chernarus. All you’ll have when you start over again are the memories of your final mistake.

Meet Others


Up to 60 players are struggling to survive by any means necessary at any given time. Make friends, kill on sight, build a base, or risk being betrayed over a can of tasty beans. Use VOIP to interact with other players however you see fit. Every encounter is meaningful when your life is always on the line. Be wary. Stay alert. Trust no one.

Survive Chernarus


The infected aren’t the only ones you need to worry about – there’s also the wildlife and elements. Evade packs of wolves and frenzied bears, find shelter from the punishing rain, search for light in the darkness of night. You’ll also need to master complex survival mechanics concerning your hunger, thirst, body temperature, and more.

Loot Up


Always make sure your gear is ready. Patch up damaged clothes, craft improvised items, and head out to deceptively dead cities to scavenge for valuable resources. Fix a car and hide it in your secret base under a cover of well-placed traps. Step into contaminated zones if you dare and keep your eyes peeled for precious loot. Don’t forget that you won’t get far without a full hazard suit and gas mask.

Take your Shot


Intense PvP action can break out anywhere at any time, especially in hotspots like abandoned military bases, where heart-pounding firefights are all the rage. Some survivors want your loot, others are simply hunting for sport. Then there are those who are afraid you’ll shoot first. Learn how to fight and know when the time has come to swallow your pride and flee. One bullet can change absolutely everything. Always watch your back.

Install Mods


Head on over to the Steam Workshop and find a customized server that fits. Join an active community of like-minded players and modify your DayZ experience to suit your taste. Browse thousands of fan-made features, maps, and guns – all of which are easily managed directly from the game launcher.

Will you team up with strangers and stay strong together? Or play as a lone wolf to avoid betrayal? This is DayZ – this is your story.

reviews.review:
Game is about a decade old and the zombies still glitchily bounce around, phase through doors, walls, you and your attacks. Gunshots don't register, suppressed shots pull every zombie with a 20 km radius. Zombie path finding is absurd, you run through the woods, through 15 buildings across a river and over a mountain and the zombie chasing you is on your ass and not even broken a sweat. Loot spawn sucks. You get hungry / die of starvation way too quickly. Trying to constantly repair your gear sucks. Weapons break after 5 swings/shots. Sickness sucks, in the "cold" for 2 seconds? Fatally ill. The new sprain/broken leg system sucks, get hit by one zombie? Broken leg, wince and blurred screen with every step. Oh and good f**king luck finding a vehicle.

Game is just laborious.  After all this time they've made it prettier, it gets good frame rates. But what does it matter when the core game is still ass.
2k hours had some fun
Hands down one of the best games I have ever played. It gives you a unique survival experience that no other game has came close to replicating. 10/10

Played this game a few years back with a friend. Found it to be a buggy mess and mostly a grind with a frustrating UI. Now, years later, I'm playing it with friends I'm finding it to be a buggy mess with frustrating UI. This feels like a game made by people that hate people who play games. There's very little fun about finding an item only for it to break and be useless after fighting 3 zombies or opening 2 cans of food. 2/10 and that feels generous.
You'll need at least an entire day to figure out how to play unmodded. Combat mechanics feel ancient.
zombies. rain. pain.

After a few hours I managed to steal all the food and guns from all the houses in the city, killed 6 people, took their clothes, smoked weed and then i went back home to eat what i found. Then i got bored and hopped on dayz with my kitten and had the best experience of my life. 10/10 recommend it
fire game

The best quote in this game to have is:

If we die we die.

Without this quote i would have 10hrs and no friends in this game although im gay.
Only good if you play with friends.When u play alone u can play for max 2h and get borred so fast.Overall good game,still best survival game
great game
Played this game ever since the original release (way back when) It has its problems but its like no other survival game out there and it offers a very unique gaming experience <3

I've been playing this game since the first weeks. It was a shame at the time. Most of my friends got disgusted by the bugs poor contents etc BUT with (many, many) years passing, it became stable, with better content and a pretty fair balance in the loot economy, PVE / PVP challenges etc. I still love to play it from time to time, Chernarus is beautiful and whomever loves sandbox games may love this one.
I got to eat a human. YUMMY
it good

Its a gruelling game where you will die again and again and again. First time you will be domed by a player over a nice looking shirt, the second time you will get mauled by one or several zombies, the second time you will find food, then shit yourself to death because of cholera or salmonella, etc. 

The game focuses alot on a kind of realism that can be alot of fun. Be prepared to use a mic in this game because players will kill you if you dont speak, typing isnt good enough. You can play all the way from an easy, +loot game, or a game where it rains constantly, theres almost no loot, and you will have to stop every 500 meters to light a fire and wring out your clothes and let them dry before you go on. Some servers let you build tents, bases, get vehicles etcetera. This game is a walking simulator on some maps, but other community maps are smaller and allows for a lot more player engagement. This game is full of stories, both good and bad, some hilarious.

I knew about this game since like, 2015 or so, but JSchlatt really made me want to play this game. THis game is hard as nails, it takes alot to figure it out, im still a big fat noob at 40 hours and i usually die before i manage to get inland, especially on populated servers where all the coasts and first towns are looted completely, since people respawn more often than they stay alive. It can be a tiresome game, i get headaches from the grass texture after a few hours of playing, i dont have anyone to play this game with, so i play solo. I reccommend this game with friends, or find a group you can play with, preferably a friend or two.
best survival game ever i run 4 servers, make mods and have 2 maps coming out soon. look out for fogfall and mysticisle
i'll try again in 10 years

applist.name: MOBILE SUIT GUNDAM BATTLE OPERATION 2
applist.detailed_description:
This is a free-to-play team battle action game based on the "Mobile Suit Gundam" series of the Universal Century.
Whether by land or by space, lay waste to your foes using either your favorite Mobile Suit or roam the battlefield as infantry and capture important objectives.

■Maximum 6 vs. 6 online battles
Join players around the globe in 6v6 team online battles on realistic battlefields!

■Infantry Combat
Mobile Suits aren't the only heroes on the battlefield! Take on the role of a pilots that can place bombs in enemy bases or request support fire to contribute to the cause!

■Acquire & Customize Mobile Suits

Acquire new Mobile Suits using the DP you earn from matches, or by using purchased tokens from our weekly Supply Drops

Once acquired, develop your Mobile Suits by customizing specific parts and weapons, or unlocking other important abilities through the hangar

■Base Camp
An online lobby where you can connect with players from around the world!
As a pilot, you can strengthen your MS and prepare for various battles in the base camp. In addition, you can freely interact with various war buddies on the road!

reviews.review:
Okayish gameplay bogged down by too many issues to count. The biggest being whether the game even works, as it feels like it is constantly taken offline every other day for impromptu maintenance.

There is an impressive amount of mobile suits from basically every Gundam series on tap, and this has been monetized to the max with gacha mechanics and loot boxes. You are given free currency and some free suits as a new player, but you will quickly learn who the paypigs are once you drop into a handful of quick matches.

Also, true to scammy gacha fashion, all suits have an arbitrary "rarity" denoted by its stars so even if you own the same suit as someone, their suit will have arbitrarily higher stats due to having more stars. Combat is filled with stunlocking and melee scrubbery,  as the optimal strategy is to simply chain-stagger an enemy with powerful weapons until you can finish them off easily.

All the animations are infuriatingly slow and it takes your suit about 20 seconds to get up when knocked on its ass. The customization and some of the shooting gameplay can be fun, there's just too much else negative for me to recommend it.

It's free so try it if you want, you might have fun until you get dropped in a lobby filled with paypigs piloting gold-plated Gundams.

1 day 5 hour ban for disconnecting from broken matches, nice; I want my newbie bonus drops back. maybe once you guys fix the game I wont have a disconnect rating preventing me from having to spend money to enjoy the newbie supply drops. Real nice of you, real nice. 

Also might not recommend this game if you're allergic to spending money on gacha games.

the 20% of the time that the game works as intended it is everything I loved about GBO2 on the PS4 I just Cannot recommend it in its current state.

Gameplay:
8/10
Perhaps a little slow, but once you learn the ebb and flow of combat its a really nice Gundam game.

Performance:
1/10
Matchmaking is broken, matches tend to lock up and it boots you out of matchmaking 60% of the time.

Network:
7/10
Laggy, manageable, but laggy.
Fxxx Bandai
♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Bandai

applist.name: Marvel’s Spider-Man: Miles Morales
applist.detailed_description:
Steam Exclusive Offer


Link your Steam Account to PlayStation™ Network to receive these early unlock bonuses:

  • Early Access to the Miles Morales 2099 Suit
  • Two Skill Points

Link portal can be found on the Marvel’s Spider-Man: Miles Morales game menu.


About the Game

Following the events of Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered, teenager Miles Morales is adjusting to his new home while following in the footsteps of his mentor, Peter Parker, as a new Spider-Man. But when a fierce power struggle threatens to destroy his new home, the aspiring hero realizes that with great power, there must also come great responsibility. To save all of Marvel’s New York, Miles must take up the mantle of Spider-Man and own it.

Key Features

The Rise of Miles Morales

Miles Morales discovers explosive powers that set him apart from his mentor, Peter Parker. Master his unique, bio-electric venom blast attacks and covert camouflage power alongside spectacular web-slinging acrobatics, gadgets and skills.

A War for Power

A war for control of Marvel’s New York has broken out between a devious energy corporation and a high-tech criminal army. With his new home at the heart of the battle, Miles must learn the cost of becoming a hero and decide what he must sacrifice for the greater good.

A Vibrant New Home

Traverse the snowy streets of his new, vibrant, and bustling neighborhood as Miles searches for a sense of belonging. When the lines blur between his personal and crime-fighting lives, he discovers who he can trust, and what it feels like to truly be home.

PC Features

PC Optimized Graphics

Enjoy a variety of graphics quality options to tailor to a wide range of devices, unlocked framerates, and support for other technologies including performance boosting NVIDIA DLSS 3 and NVIDIA DLSS 2, image quality enhancing NVIDIA DLAA, and latency-reducing NVIDIA Reflex. Upscaling technologies AMD FSR 2.1, Intel XeSS and IGTI are also supported.

Ray-traced reflections and shadows*

See the city come to life with stunning ray-traced reflection and ray-traced shadow options with a variety of quality modes to choose from.

Ultra-wide Monitor support**

Take in the cinematic sights of Marvel’s New York with support for a range of screen setups, including 16:9, 16:10, 21:9, 32:9, and 48:9 resolutions. 48:9 resolutions with triple monitor setups are compatible with NVIDIA Surround or AMD Eyefinity.

Controls and Customization

Feel what it’s like to play as Spider-Man through immersive haptic feedback and dynamic trigger effects using a PlayStation DualSense™ controller on a wired USB connection. Enjoy full mouse and keyboard support with various customizable control options.

*Compatible PC required
**Compatible PC and display device required

reviews.review:
Alright, so after completing all achievements I feel like this game has some decent replayablilty. But I do have my share of complaints and praises about this game.

1. This game is too short. I mean for almost the same price as Marvel's Spiderman, I finished all objectives in well around 26 hrs as compared to the 100+ hrs it took me for Spiderman.
2. There needs to be some varieties of enemies and bosses. I feel like I only remember Prowler, Rhino and Tinkerer fights, but then again the first point kinda covers it.
3. The venom and cloaking are awesomely done in this game, loved those abilities.
4. Costumes are downright sick, better than the Spiderman ones' imo.
5. Ran really well on Steam Deck (finished it on deck).

If this game had the same or almost similar amount of gameplay content as Spiderman, this would have been my favorite spiderman game yet.

Iac, this game is worth playing, maybe get it on sale coz original price ain't worth it.

I love the game so much! I really do! But the pc version just keeps crashing for no reason and I cant fix it, ive heard this is a common problem but the devs havent fixed it in however many months the pc port has been out

A visual spectacle. The movement mechanics and the finishers in the game scream "Next Level". surely an enjoyable game has some amazing tracks in it if you wanna vibe but the puzzles don't seem to be a challenge at all and very few boss fights and not that difficult. A very good game considering how  small it is.

My score : 7.6/10

Spider-Man: Miles Morales swings onto the scene, captivating fans with a thrilling and heartfelt adventure. Developed by Insomniac Games, this highly anticipated follow-up to the critically acclaimed Spider-Man game for PlayStation delivers an unforgettable experience that showcases the incredible powers and growth of Miles Morales as he embraces his role as the friendly neighborhood Spider-Man.

Set in the snowy backdrop of a wintery New York City, the game immediately immerses you in its richly detailed and vibrant world. The visual enhancements and attention to detail on the PlayStation 5 are truly remarkable, with stunning graphics, fluid animations, and breathtaking lighting effects that bring the city to life. From the snowy rooftops to the bustling streets, every corner of the city feels alive and interactive, making exploration a joyous experience.

Miles Morales takes center stage as the protagonist, and his character development shines throughout the game. As a mixed-race teenager grappling with the weight of responsibility, Miles's journey is not only about becoming a hero but also about finding his own identity. The writing beautifully explores themes of family, friendship, and the power of community. It's refreshing to see a superhero story that delves into the personal struggles and triumphs of its protagonist, creating a strong emotional connection between the player and Miles.

The gameplay in Spider-Man: Miles Morales is a seamless blend of acrobatic web-swinging, thrilling combat, and innovative new powers unique to Miles. Swinging through the city is an absolute delight, with the DualSense controller providing haptic feedback that enhances the sensation of web-slinging. Combat is fluid and dynamic, allowing for a variety of stylish moves, venom-powered attacks, and clever gadgets that keep encounters fresh and exciting.

One of the standout features of the game is the inclusion of Miles's electric-based powers, known as "venom abilities." These abilities add a new layer of gameplay depth, empowering players to unleash devastating attacks, manipulate energy, and perform electrifying combos. The combination of these powers with Miles's acrobatics makes for thrilling and visually stunning battles against a diverse array of enemies.

The side quests and activities in the game offer a satisfying balance between engaging storytelling and enjoyable gameplay. Each mission feels purposeful and contributes to the overall narrative, allowing players to delve deeper into the world and connect with its vibrant cast of characters. Additionally, the inclusion of various collectibles and challenges provides ample opportunities for exploration and rewards.

Spider-Man: Miles Morales also benefits from an outstanding musical score that complements the game's tone and elevates key moments. The soundtrack blends hip-hop and orchestral elements, perfectly capturing the essence of Miles's journey and adding an extra layer of immersion to the overall experience.

In conclusion, Spider-Man: Miles Morales is a spectacular addition to the Spider-Man universe. With its stunning visuals, captivating storytelling, and thrilling gameplay, it successfully builds upon its predecessor while delivering a heartfelt and empowering tale of a new hero finding his place in the world. Whether you're a fan of the webslinger or new to the franchise, this game is an absolute must-play, showcasing the power of heroism and the strength that comes from within.

Spider-Man: Miles Morales is a more condensed and standalone experience of 2018’s mainline Sony’s Spider-Man.

The game is quite short, clocking at around 10-12 hours if you focus on the main story. I personally find this a negative for the game, letting the plot cook and gameplay progression requiring investment a bit more could’ve made this a more memorable experience.

Despite that, I still think this is a very good videogame and should be what a AAA game offers, a competently-made product that is fun, paced out well, and utilizes the production value to tell stories and experiences in the best way possible. Insomniac’s Spider-Man series managed to put every part of what they wanted the game to be into very good places, which can be a rare sight for big games these days.
If you’ve already played 2018’s Spider-Man, you should have a very good idea of what this game is by now. But for those who don’t, I recommend playing and completing the first game before playing Miles Morales.

The open world genre for Spider-Man is simply perfect. With our hero’s agility and web slinging power, it is only right for the virtual playground to be as free and open as possible. The implementation of this genre can go in many different ways, but Insomniac has done it right. New York is the perfect fit for Spider-Man’s movement. The abundant buildings and narrow streets are great for traversing with slings and parkour techniques, but Spider-Man can also swing a little higher and jump from rooftop to rooftop as well. Mile Morales’s version of New York  also offers a new coat of paint by it being in the Christmas season. Snow covered streets and brick buildings make the city feel nostalgic yet unpredictable. People on the sidewalks are talking to one another and commenting on Spider-man swinging by. Car drivers beep their horns and shout mean words to one another. Meanwhile, some rooftops host barbeque parties and have people hanging about, calmed from the chaotic world below. This depiction of New York is so true to life, and only rivaled by the likes of Ubisoft’s The Division and GTA IV’s similar Liberty City.

Scattered around the city are collectables and side activities that are colored brightly on the map. The number of distractions are moderated very well, and I never felt overwhelmed or bored going after these side content for completion. It would take only around 3-4 hours to go around and collect everything, which is fitting for how short the main story is. Aside from the pre-placed game elements, there are also randomly spawned Crimes that you can partake in. These serve as random mini combat encounters and a way to earn XP. These pop up once every 20-40 seconds when you travel through the city, which doesn’t make it too annoying and keeps the open world alive.

What impresses me a lot about Insomniac Spider-Man is how great the combat system is. From stealth to combat, it just feels so right. The focus on Spidey’s agility and aggressiveness in combat not only make the game engaging, but also super cinematic as well. Miles has the ability to use his bioelectric power to damage multiple enemies or lower their defenses, which flow very with the standard fighting rhythm introduced in 2018’s. Another thing that also pleasantly surprises me is how seriously Insomniac takes New Game + mode. From the get-go, in the upgrades menu, there are already teases of what is unlockable in New Game +, almost like they are luring you to beat this game and then come back for even more. I love this design decision and would like to see more games toy with player’s excitement like this.

To combat the player's increase in power, the enemies in Miles Morales pack some serious punches. Early on in the game, there are still standard enemies with bare fists and guns. But later on, they can block your attacks, prevent you from using powers, or be immune to certain moves entirely. This creates the dynamic of you constantly recognizing which enemy you are fighting and how to deal with each one. But this isn’t Rock, Paper, Scissors, most enemies can still be beaten by a string of normal punches and kicks, but the ways the game throws these enemies at you make you want to utilize everything that you have, in order to dispatch these foes fast and as stylish as possible.

The Story of Mile Morales is the main thing I think could be better. Due to the game's runtime, you get so little time to bond over the characters involved with Miles. They are likable and have each of their own moments to shine, but they are not complex. Complexity in friends and family can really improve a Spider-Man’s plot, in my opinion, it being mostly a coming-of-age story and all that. This game is more short and sweet, like a spin-off movie, rather than it trying to tell a comprehensive development of Miles himself, which isn’t wrong, I just wish it was different.

With everything mentioned, I think this game is a very nice package that you can boot up and instantly have a great time. It’s nice and short, but not the greatest. 7/10 a really solid buy, but not a must-play. I personally recommend it on bigger sale.

Much shorter than the original, definitely not worth the price unless you pick it up on sale or loved the original, I'd recommend playing the original first to see if you like it as this feels more like dlc.
That being said, comparing it to the original, I loved the original so I ended up having a lot of fun in this game.

It feels more like an expensive DLC. The game is pretty much the same, so much so that a lot of the unlocked skills from the previous game are preset skills in this one. It is fun and it also should have been more distinguished from the previous game

applist.name: Friends vs Friends
applist.detailed_description:
Special Offer

https://store.steampowered.com/app/2432020/Friends_vs_Friends_Deluxe_Edition_Content/


About the Game



Play 1v1 or 2v2 in online, fast-paced, chaotic combat! Gain player levels, get new cards, improve the ones you already have, and get to know an array of eclectic characters with their own unique passive skills. The best part? At this price, you can invite all of your friends to get wrecked, guilt-free!


  • Friends vs Friends: Matchmake with players worldwide in 1v1 or 2v2 combat, or host private matches with your friends. Need Support? Invite your friends to spectate!
  • A Game with Character: Choose from a stylish cast of characters, each with their own abilities that improve the synergies of your deck.
  • Low Price + High Quality = How?!: In order to keep the crew together, we made sure to level the playing field on cost so jumping in is a big-brain move.
  • Progress to Impress: Level up and get new cards through matched bouts and timed challenges.
  • Stack Your Deck: Collect weapon, trap, and curse cards, then level them up to increase their power.
  • Updates and Seasonal Content: Expect post-launch content including new unique characters, cards, maps, and upgrades to your home base.
  • Play Dress-up: Unlock cool cosmetics like skins and card design variants for bragging rights!
  • Practice, Practice, Practice: Go up against bots to try out new card combos and improve your skills for when it counts.



 
🎵 Let me tell you ‘bout some friends who invested all they had in a shady site that looked like a scam 🎵

reviews.review: I have no friends
I promise i am not a furry

Rarely do i write reviews, but some wrong info in these reviews makes me feel obligated to.

Friends Vs Friends is a 1v1 or 2v2 Fast Paced Deck Building FPS. Think Furry Quake if your opponent can activate vampire poison bullets on a katana while moving 40% faster. You buy packs with in game currency to get new cards and upgrade your current ones, and some of these get quite unique. Head exposure reveals an enemy brain above the rivals head for 4 seconds that amps damage 10x, which can be countered by cards like tin man that turns you and your ally invincible for temporarily while slowing you. It's a really interesting system that opens the door for many different playstyles and decks.

The maps are all fun despite there only being 4 of them right now, each giving a different range of engagement and lending itself to certain decks and characters better than others. Trucks is a compact map with moving parts and deadly falls into the road that makes movement speed and close range more important than trying to keep distance, where rooftops is 2 roofs that make both long range play and rush strats viable. The characters are much the same way, each giving a massive influence over how you build your deck, such as explosive resistance, starting with a Brasshopper smg, double jumps, ect.

To clear up misinfo, no you cannot buy cards with real money. There are no microtransactions in this game. The deluxe edition gives no card packs, just access to upcoming expansions.

Yes, you can 2v2 with a friend against random. Just open your ui menu, and there's an invite button on the top right. When they join, hit 2v2. You are now playing Friends Vs Friends with your friends.

Some actual issues with the game right now is the progression, but as of right now they came out with a patch that "fixes" progression that I have not played. An issue that is here is explosives clipping your camera into the floor or walls from the flinch. This happens to enemies too, particularly to moose for some reason, making it really disorienting when a bomb goes off. I've heard of it happening with being hit by a sniper but I haven't had this.

All in all, wonderful game. If you have friends, queue up 2v2 and work together with your decks and you'll curb stomp in no time.

The game is amazing but one problem I've already ran into is the cheaters. With in the first 2 hrs of playing someone was hitting every head shot so I did my research to look if theirs hacks for this game and first 10mins found it https://www.aimjunkies.com/cheats-mods-aimbot/friends-vs-friends i hope they add anticheat and not easyanticheat please that shit is trash.
there's a crocodile and i can play as them

Look I can tell a lot of love went into this game and it has a great original idea but honestly it just doesn't work. I give it a lot of credit for not being pay to win and having a lot of personality but game play wise a lot of stuff needs to be fixed or outright scrapped to save this games life.

 First off and this is the most important point is that its entirely hostile to new players and its not even an issue of skill here, the problem lies in the cards leveling system. New players get base cards with no levels putting them at a huge disadvantage against the sweats and veteran players which will kill your player base post launch. This is the same issue battlefront had with its cards because its a no fun zone for people just trying to get ahead of the curve. 

Second is the leveling and how its a grind to get new character unlocks. Getting tokens and card packs is a major grind and takes forever to get a hold of. At level 10 with 7 hours so far I have bought like 3 gold card packs. I mean there's nothing else to spend your money on and since the game just started I understand, just hoping its temporary until the game gets more content. Also that weird gumball machine thing for cosmetics, like getting tokens for that is near impossible since you need 3 and only get like 1 token for completing daily tasks that are a whole other grind fest for new players. 

The characters are cool and unique but giving them special cards that are just like free op weapons isnt a good idea. I think that the characters who get free weapons at the start should either have a nerfed version of the gun or just scarp giving people weapons unless its in a card. Like use Duck Anderson as a model for this because Im tired of these guys who get to start off with smgs and katanas who build decks based around getting up in your face and having do defense against them. Like close quarters guns dominate this game and I would like to see some balance changes in the future.

TLDR: Game is pretty but game play needs a heavy overhaul. New players get no love. Hope to see major changes.

The cards system and voxel graphics bring a unique spin to the arena shooter genre. Game runs fantastic and has a 100+ FOV slider. Weekly updates means lots of new content to look forward to. 

Balancing needs some work, some cards when used together can almost decide the fight before it starts. Only four maps means the matches can feel a little repetitive.

tldr: A must try for all FPS enjoyers, and an absolute steal at $5.99.

[h1] An incredible Gem with Devs Who Listen [/h1]

Not a day after the game is out and complaints heard by amazing devs have seen the progression system generously tweaked. A patch this morning at lightning speed took the progression from glacial to reasonable in one fell swoop. This feels like a much better place for the game and I'm much happier with how it is to get cards and xp now. That being my biggest complaint there really isn't a reason to ignore this one if you're at all looking for a quirky shooter that has been carefully crafted with love. I'd still like to see quests at least tweaked to "play" based objectives instead of win. As to the developers comment about friends helping friends complete quests. Personally I don't see such a problem with that. Daily quests get us to log in. If the game is fun enough we'll play anyway (and this one certainly is). 

In addition to the very helpful changes to xp and cash gain they even added level based matchmaking that tries to match you near your current player level. It's not MMR but absolutely fixes the issue I had with some players already using level 4 versions of cards. 

The remaining complaints are minor enough and if this first patch is anything to go off of will likely be fixed and probably are already seen. I still think the cosmetic coins are stingy and would still think they were a bit stingy if we got 1 every game. Quests should absolutely be available sooner than level 8 and need that switch from "win" to "play" but these are minor problems.

This game is incredibly generous. My previous bellyaching was really an ache for a game with so much promise and joy to give me a yet smoother experience. The truth is for the cost of a cheap lunch I've already spent hours laughing and smiling with my friends and that's absolutely worth it. This game is a gift and the price is a steal and if you're at all on the edge here please let me push you over it and while you're diving in, grab your friends too.

Now if only there were some mini games to play in this diner.

[b](OLD REVIEW LEFT BELOW FOR COMPARISON)[/b]

This game has charm, it's got ritz, the guns sound right, the music is lovely, the animation when you open the game is exciting, catchy and fun! They even have a hub to mess around in while you wait to find a match. Interesting level design, Unique core concept and what is probably one of the worst progression systems I've seen in a non free to play game. Mind you there are no microtransactions but honestly I've seen games that squeeze you for gold or gems that are more generous.

After 8 hours of play I managed a total of 10 levels and half of them didn't get me anything. Packs cost way too much and your xp and cash you gain takes forever. Quests usually want you to win and you don't even get them until level 8. When you do get quests they ask you to do absurdly long tasks. "win 8 1v1 games" w h a t?! With the average win rate being 50% that's like asking me to play 16 games. Except its not because theres no MMR so if you struggle with the game at all you'll never be completing these quests. Go on a losing streak? Get ready to feel it. Worst of all about the current quest system is that [b] in a game literally titled "Friends vs Friends" you cannot complete quests against your friends. You are punished for fighting your friends.[/b]

Cosmetics are in this game and accessable with in game earned currency. That's kinda cool! Except to get them you need to do ALL 3 of your daily quests and that gets you 1 token of 3 that you need to put into a literal gacha machine to get a chance for 1 cosmetic. Did you get a bad one? Don't worry after another 24 actual hours of gameplay you might have your next one. Here's hoping you get something besides a profile picture for the following roll!

This would all be fine but the guy who's been playing since the beta has a lv 4 gun and 3 cards you've never seen before and will absolutely delete you the second you walk out with your "big head mode" card you just played. This is a masterful and amazingly well made game that's so close to where I want it to be. I'll change this review when I see an update made to address the absolutely painful progression.

The developers claim they'll change this soon. When they do I'll change this review.
reviews.developer_response:
Hey! 

We have patched the game with a faster progression and also a better matchmaking system that look for players with the same level (or near to that) which means the same amount of cards or card's level.

About the progression we are tunning it, the last patch set it a bit more faster so we will be tweaking during these first days.

Regarding to completing quest with friends we had that back in the time and people used it to exploit the game. But we are looking for options because i feel similar to you about this,

Thanks for the feedback! <3

FIFA 23: The Worst Game in the History of Gaming
Warning: Proceed at your own peril. FIFA 23 is a disgrace to the gaming community and a tragic waste of your time, money, and sanity.

As a long-time fan of football and video games, I never thought I'd see the day when I would be forced to write such a scathing review. But here we are, with FIFA 23, a game that has not only failed to live up to its predecessors, but has also managed to become an unmitigated disaster in every sense of the word.

I cannot emphasize enough how bad FIFA 23 is. Imagine a steaming pile of garbage on your doorstep, and you're getting close. This game is so deplorable, it's almost an insult to refer to it as a "game." It's more like a cruel prank, a travesty that shakes the very foundations of the gaming world.

Sickening Gameplay
If you thought the gameplay in previous FIFA titles was smooth and enjoyable, prepare to be bitterly disappointed. FIFA 23 has taken all the elements that made its predecessors great and thrown them out the window. The controls are clunky, unresponsive, and frustrating. It's as if the developers coded the game with their eyes closed and their hands tied behind their backs.

Disgraceful Graphics
Despite having access to next-gen technology, FIFA 23 looks like it was made in the late '90s. The graphics are so abysmal that it's difficult to tell which pixelated blob is supposed to represent your favorite footballer. The stadiums, the crowd, and even the grass on the pitch – everything is an eyesore.

Unforgivable In-Game Purchases
FIFA 23 has taken microtransactions to an entirely new level of greed. It's as if EA Sports wants to suck every last cent out of your pocket. The game is so heavily designed around in-game purchases that it's virtually impossible to progress or enjoy the experience without shelling out an exorbitant amount of money.

A Laughable Career Mode
The career mode in FIFA 23 is an absolute joke. It's as if the developers put no thought or effort into creating a compelling and immersive experience. Instead, they've given us a shallow, uninteresting, and downright boring mode that will make you question why you even bothered to turn on your console.

To Sum It Up
FIFA 23 is, without a doubt, the worst game ever created. It's an affront to the gaming community and a disgrace to the FIFA franchise. If you value your time, money, and sanity, stay far away from this abomination.

Do yourself a favor and avoid FIFA 23 at all costs. This is not a game. It's a nightmare.
FIFA 17: Episode VII - The Momentum Awakens

applist.name: Project Zomboid
applist.detailed_description:
Project Zomboid is an open-ended zombie-infested sandbox. It asks one simple question – how will you die? 

In the towns of Muldraugh and West Point, survivors must loot houses, build defences and do their utmost to delay their inevitable death day by day. No help is coming – their continued survival relies on their own cunning, luck and ability to evade a relentless horde.

Current Features


  • Hardcore Sandbox Zombie Survival Game with a focus on realistic survival.
  • Online multiplayer survival with persistent player run servers.
  • Local 4 player split-screen co-op
  • Hundreds of zombies with swarm mechanics and in-depth visual and hearing systems.
  • Full line of sight system and real-time lighting, sound and visibility mechanics. Hide in the shadows, keep quiet and keep the lights off at night, or at least hang sheets over the windows.
  • Vast and growing map (loosely based on a real world location) for you to explore, loot and set up your fortress. Check out Blindcoder’s map project: https://map.projectzomboid.com/
  • Vehicles with full physics and deep and realistic gameplay mechanics.
  • Use tools and items to craft weapons, barricade and cook. You can even build zombie proof forts by chopping trees, sawing wood and scavenging supplies.
  • Deal with depression, boredom, hunger, thirst and illness while trying to survive.
  • Day turns to night. The electricity falters. Hordes migrate. Winter draws in. Nature gradually starts to take over.
  • Farming, fishing, carpentry, cooking, trapping, character customization, skills and perks that develop based on what you do in-game.
  • Proper zombies that don’t run. (Unless you tell them to in the sandbox menu).
  • A ton of amazing atmospheric music tracks by the prodigy that is Zach Beever.
  • Imaginative Challenge scenarios and instant action ‘Last Stand’ mode, on top of regular Sandbox and Survival 
  • Full, open and powerful Lua modding support.
  • Xbox Controller Gamepad support on Windows. [Others pads can be set up manually. Gamepad support not currently available on Mac]

    We’re a small team at the moment, but we’re also committed to providing the following:

    planned Features:


  • The return of our PZ Stories mode that also serves as first ever tutorial actively trying to kill you at every turn. Kate and Baldspot return!
  • In-depth and varied NPC encounters driven in a persistent world, powered by a metagame system that turns each play-through into your very own zombie survival movie with emergent narrative gameplay.
  • Constant expansion of the countryside and cities around Muldraugh and West Point
  • Full wilderness survival systems, animals and hunting for food.
  • More items, crafting recipes, weapons and gameplay systems.
  • Steam Workshop and Achievements support

For more details on the game follow us on @theindiestone or visit http://www.projectzomboid.com

applist.short_description: Project Zomboid is the ultimate in zombie survival. Alone or in MP: you loot, build, craft, fight, farm and fish in a struggle to survive. A hardcore RPG skillset, a vast map, massively customisable sandbox and a cute tutorial raccoon await the unwary. So how will you die? All it takes is a bite..

reviews.review:
I'm a 41 year old dad and I absolutely love playing this with my 16 year old son. Don't get caught up over losing loot to dying to a zombie bite or drinking bleach accidentally, it's just part of the game. Let your kid choose where you spawn, or where to loot, or even letting him drive and just have fun stabbing and running from zeds for an evening. I focus on looting supplies to keep us alive, he works the combat and is an excellent fighter.

An awesome game to bond over, and a great way to talk about how to survive a zombie apocalypse, how to deal with disappointment, how to work as a team when deciding who keeps the best loot, and how to never give up, He loves to kill zeds, will upend a planned looting trip to help some zombie get his head bashed in with a frying pan. Great game to play with your kids.

i may be a little gay

I woke up in my small house in the town called Riverside, The TV was on talking about a "Knox Event" or whatever. I went outside to check what was going on and low and behold. My neighbor was feasting on his wife or whoever she was. I quickly ran inside to grab the nearest weapon i had, but i only had a few cooking utensils and some books. I picked up a frying pan i had put in a cabinet and ventured out through by backdoor. My yard wasnt really that big, a dozen of people i had never seen before was roaming around the yard groaning and yelling, i run inside again and decide it might be a better idea to go out the frontdoor instead.

 My neighbor was still eating on a now unregonsiseable corpse. He notices me and groans at me, slowly getting on his feet he and stumbling closer and closer to me. I take out the frying pan and when he got close enough to me i bashed him on his head. He made a sound and fell to the ground, he wasnt dead yet, but just writhing in pain on the ground. Even though it should had given him atleast some brain damage, he got up again and attacked me again, without any luck of course. I hit him a few more times, and at last he stops breathing and making noises. I take no time to think what had just happend, because behind me, 3 or more shamblers had heard all the commotion and were now walking towards me. Me and my frying pan were no match for all of these folk, so i run across the street were my neighboor had a car parked, i jump inside the car hoping the car was still intact, but of couse it wasnt. The shamblers were getting closer to the car i was sitting in and i quickly jumped out and ran into the house the car was parked infront of. The owner was home, only he was quite dead. A woman stood at the window banging on it while groaing. I sneak up behind her, and bang her on the head, she -like the other one- falls to the ground. And instead of waiting for her to get up, i bash her brains in with my trusty frying pan. The other shamblers were now at the front door, banging on it.

I quickly ran out of the back door and went around the corner but what i hadnt noticed was that 2 shamblers had for some unknown reason decided to stand right there, i couldnt manage to stop sprinting, so i plow through them. Bad decision. I fall to the ground with a scraped knee and the other shambler couldnt resist and she took a bite out of my shoulder.
 Panic hit me, and i ran onto the main street and took my socks off and ripped them so i could use them as makeshift bandage. The comics i had read a long time ago talked about if you were bitten by the undead -which i assumed these shamblers were- you were destined to die and become one of them. Across the street i saw a pharmacy, and thought "I got nothing to lose now, might aswell check for something to cure me or atleast take the pain away"

I run to the main entrance, but the door is closed. So i took out my frying pan and busted the windows open. I had forgot the glass shards and so i cut myself when going through the window. My right arm was completly ripped open. I checked the shelves for some disinfectant but there werent any. But i did find some painkillers, i chuck down a pack or 2 of painkillers and decided to hide in the backrooms of the building, i was still bleeding profusely and i heard all of the undead enter the building. This was the end. Not even a day in and i was already going to die. The shamblers were now at the door to the room i was in, bashing and hitting the door, eager to get to me so they could feast on my tasty flesh. They kick down the door and make their way towards me, i hit as many as i can, but there were too many. One of them bites my leg and i get thrown to the floor, they were all over me now, biting and scrathing all of my limbs, the pain was immesurabel i was screaming and crying. They were literally tearing me apart. Until i couldnt handle it anymore, and passed away not so peacefully and turned into one of them. 

That's basically how my first game of project zomboid went. Chaotic, Dramatic and funny as hell. You've heard it before but i'll say it again.

 BEST. SURVIVAL. GAME. TO. DATE.
Has a steep difficulty cliff but very rewarding to finally "get it"

Project Zomboid is an amazing survival game, offering a vast sandbox experience in a world overrun by zombies. Despite its simple appearance, the gameplay is rich, presenting new challenges and opportunities to learn. The modding scene is incredibly vast, further expanding the game's potential.

Every time I dive into the game, I'm faced with numerous challenges. From managing the food situation to finding suitable shelter and arranging transportation, it consistently engages me. It pushes me to think strategically, weighing the benefits of stealth versus the risks of being loud. This is the essence of what survival games should strive for, creating addictive and thoroughly enjoyable experiences.

What sets Project Zomboid apart are the small yet significant details that enhance the overall enjoyment. For instance, the logical aspect of breaking a window becomes immersive when clearing out the glass before jumping over, reducing the risk of injury.

Moreover, the game's modding scene is truly incredible. Even without mods, you can immerse yourself for days on end. However, with the vast array of mods available, the gameplay can extend for months, showcasing the game's amazing potential. The supportive community adds to the awesomeness of the overall experience, fostering a sense of camaraderie and creativity among players.

In summary, Project Zomboid delivers an exceptional survival game with a rich gameplay experience, abundant challenges, and ample opportunities to learn. The modding scene expands its replayability, while the community adds to the overall enjoyment. It's a must-play for fans of the genre.

applist.name: Destiny 2
applist.detailed_description:
Season of the Deep

Destiny 2: Season of the Deep Begins

Mystery and adventure await beneath the waves of Titan.


Into the Abyss

Saturn’s missing moon of Titan has returned, now overrun with Taken and Hive searching for something at the bottom of its methane ocean. Guardians must follow them into the deep to uncover ancient secrets and learn more about the Witness’s origins.


Salvages 


Recover Golden Age tech from sunken Arcology structures on Titan. Explore the seafloor for the first time as you face the Lucent Hive and a variety of enemies in several unpredictable encounters. 

Deep Dives 

Week over week, dive deeper into Titan’s ocean to salvage the power needed to communicate with the mysterious creature you’ve discovered. 


Fishing 

The corruption on Titan is starting to spread off-world. Try to relax and enjoy yourself as you fish for samples around the Solar System. 


Exotic Auto Rifle 

Add the catalyst and rank-100 ornament to Centrifuse as you throw caution to the wind and let the thunder roll. 


Universal Ornaments 

From the vacuum of space to the depths of the ocean, no amount of pressure can stop this style. 

Enhanced Progression 

Over 100 rewards, including XP boosts, Exotic engrams, upgrade materials, cosmetics and more. 

Season Pass 

Gear, XP, rewards! Get the Season Pass and instantly unlock the new Exotic Auto Rifle. Also get XP boosts that speed up Seasonal ranks and reward track unlocks. 

Silver Bundle 


Purchase the Season of the Deep Silver Bundle and receive a new Legendary emote along with 1,700 Silver (1,000 + 700 bonus Silver) which you can use to purchase Seasons, cosmetics, and more! Visit the Seasons tab in-game to use your Silver and buy Season of the Deep. To unlock your new emote, speak with Master Rahool in the Tower.


About the Game

Dive into the world of Destiny 2 to explore the mysteries of the solar system and experience responsive first-person shooter combat. Unlock powerful elemental abilities and collect unique gear to customize your Guardian's look and playstyle. Enjoy Destiny 2’s cinematic story, challenging co-op missions, and a variety of PvP modes alone or with friends. Download for free today and write your legend in the stars.

An Immersive Story

You are a Guardian, defender of the Last City of humanity in a solar system under siege by infamous villains. Look to the stars and stand against the darkness. Your legend begins now.

Guardian Classes

Choose from the armored Titan, mystic Warlock, or swift Hunter.


Titan
Disciplined and proud, Titans are capable of both aggressive assaults and stalwart defenses. Set your hammer ablaze, crack the sky with lightning, and go toe-to-toe with any opponent. Your team will stand tall behind the strength of your shield.

Warlock
Warlocks weaponize the mysteries of the universe to sustain themselves and destroy their foes. Rain devastation on the battlefield and clear hordes of enemies in the blink of an eye. Those who stand with you will know the true power of the Light.

Hunter
Agile and daring, Hunters are quick on their feet and quicker on the draw. Fan the hammer of your golden gun, flow through enemies like the wind, or strike from the darkness. Find the enemy, take aim, and end the fight before it starts.

Cooperative and Competitive Multiplayer

Play with or against your friends and other Guardians in various PvE and PvP game modes.


Cooperative Multiplayer
Exciting co-op adventures teeming await with rare and powerful rewards. Dive into the story with missions, quests, and patrols. Put together a small fireteam and secure the chest at the end of a quick Strike. Or test your team's skill with countless hours of raid progression – the ultimate challenge for any fireteam. You decide where your legend begins.

Competitive Multiplayer
Face off against other players in fast-paced free-for-all skirmishes, team arenas, and PvE/PvP hybrid competitions. Mark special competitions like Iron Banner on your calendar and collect limited-time rewards before they're gone.

Exotic Weapons and Armor

Thousands of weapons, millions of options. Discover new gear combinations and define your own personal style. The hunt for the perfect arsenal begins.

Thousands of weapons, millions of options. Discover new gear combinations and define your own personal style. The hunt for the perfect arsenal begins.

reviews.review:
Since the start of Lightfall and even before that Bungie has started on a path of trying to kill the game instead of making it better. Constant server issues that only get worse with each week while hearing nothing from Bungie on why the issues are occurring, if they will get better, or if they can even be fixed. Mind numbing changes that only seek to hurt the players for no reason.

The most recent stompees nerf that removes all movement speed from the exotic due to controller players not being able to "look up". There is also the titan shoulder charge nerf that now causes you to lose energy after shoulder charging even if it does not hit an enemy. While being a PvP nerf, PvE is being hit by this nerf due to the developers dying on the hill of not separating the sandboxes. While this change may not seem that impactful, let me also add that shoulder charge has worked the same way for the last 9 years. Warlocks are getting starfire not just nerfed but murdered. Starfire has needed a nerf for a while as it is an extremely dominate exotic but instead of nerfing it to be more in line with other exotics the developers have almost made it a punishment to use the exotic. Grenade energy used to be 20% while in an empowering rift and is now down to 2.5%. Lastly, lets talk about the incredible band-aid fixes to the game. The 2 second weapon cooldown. Now if you ever swap weapons in your inventory you have to wait 2 seconds before you are allowed to fire your weapon in a SHOOTER. To give some examples this would be similar to not being able to use the brakes in your vehicle should you accidentally press them or be on a very busy interstate, instead you need to wait 2 seconds. 

Finally, there is the price increase of each expansion and now the increase in prices of seasons by an extra 5 dollars. I'm not even going to get into the costs of the game as in my stance I normally buy the most expensive edition as I play the game a lot unfortunately but going the cheaper route is even more expensive. From the expansions to now increased season price and dungeon keys the game is not only offering so little for that cost but also doing nothing to improve the game server wise, it's only getting worse.

For my last bit of advice, if you are new to the game or think about checking it out and never having played Destiny. 

STAY FAR AWAY

This game is the most unfriendly new player experience I have ever witnessed. Playing through the New Light aka New player experience as an experienced person shows the issues with the game and what it's not teaching new players. The craziest part is this feedback has been given to Bungie the last 2-3 years now and yet they still refuse how to teach new players to play the game. Instead they teach new players how to play a game for their very first time. For instance, they teach you that "Space Bar" is jump instead of teaching you that weapons within destiny have different perk combinations on them, or that subclasses have different benefits and how to properly use them in combat.

From recent events it is apparent that the team that worked on the game during the Beyond Light era and even the Witch Queen era is gone. They are either working on one of the 7 trillion new projects that Bungie has spread themselves too thin doing or went to a new game studio.

Destiny 2 is a black hole for your time.

I find myself coming back every time a new piece of content is dropped, but this is out of no love of the content that I am receiving. Attempting to introduce Destiny 2 to new players reveals the number of fatal flaws this game's business model contains, namely that it's now essentially impossible for new people to get invested in Destiny as a franchise.

Old content has been vaulted away, never to be seen again. This includes but is not limited to the original campaign that this game was offering as it's primary story (of which future content would build upon rather than replace). The story of Destiny 2 is unplayable within Destiny 2, all that remains are DLCs priced the same as full installments for AAA releases.

Lightfall was particulary dissapointing, but arguably the decline began in Shadowkeep, and even the original Red War campaign was never that good. The game is fundamentally a grind-fest, not to mention the numerous arbitrary limitations on resources and currencies to make that grind as painful and tedious as possible.

Harder content that most dedicated players would say is the point of playing the game, like Raids and Dungeons, is either locked behind a seemingly endless line of filler content pretending to be story, or is locked behind a completely arbitrary power cap that is constantly increasing due to rampant power creep.

I could go on but I don't need to.
I will still continue to play this game, purely out of my sunk-cost fallacy.
Bungie, I liked you during the Halo days, but now you've turn sour.

Bring back ALL of the vaulted legacy content, remove all of the arbitrary limit on resources, and actually try to make a DLC campaign that does more than look nice and waste your time (and money). THEN, we'll talk.
it's embarrassing what destiny has become lmao

They removed content that I paid for. Yeah it was a long time ago, yeah the content was old, but what the hell. GTFO Bungie. Either give me my content back or my money, then maybe I'll think about buying another one of your expansions.

Also I have well over a thousand hours on xbox, but I have just been bitterly unwilling to touch the game at all now.
its like crack but you get nothing in return
I'm running out of kidneys to sell.
Nobody will read my review, so I'll just say i'm gay.
eh, if you wanna cry everytime you open a game this aint bad
destiny players= no life

I put in over 2500 hours into destiny 1 and over 2000 in destiny 2. I stuck with this game through its few short lived highs and many long term failures. I never had the attitude that Bungie could do no wrong but I wanted to believe  they would continue to evolve the game and make it better. Lightfall launched and I felt like many, it was a huge disappointment and did little if nothing to evolve the franchise. I didn't even finish the campaign, and took a 2 week break from the game 2 weeks later, like someone in an abusive relationship, I decided to log back on and finish the campaign and other content I had paid 100 dollars for/ I was met with a message that said I was banned. This was very confusing to me seeing as I never used cheats or did anything I was aware of that was against T.o.s. There was no way to contact bungie  other than their terribly implemented forums. Upon submitting an appeal all I got in response was that the ban would not be overturned. They did not provide me with any reason as to why I was banned ( because there wasn't one ) . Myself and many others had thousands of hours of their time and over a thousand dollars of content  wrongly taken from them with no recourse and no explanation. I never thought i would say this but because of this i feel bungie is more predatory than activision/ blizzard  in this manner because even they would not issue a permaband with no explanation.

TLDR
Do not play this game unless you wish to have thousands of hours and dollars wrongly taken from you with no explanation why.Any one who gives a dime to this company is setting a dangerous precedent that gaming developers do not have to be accountable to the players who support them. If you're looking for a good mmo experience there are plenty of much better mmos . The game had potential 5 years ago and it was squandered . Not only that but Bungies had decided to cannibalize their most loyal player in a lukewarm attempt to be perceived as doing something to fix the many broken aspects of the game. I don't thing disappointed even sums up how i and many other feel about bungie,
Just dont

the lack of a main story, or even a way to look back on what you missed REALLY holds his game back for new players. as someone who's been playing since taken king, i love this game to death, but its damn near impossible for new people to get into it without watching a 3 hour long video about the story and characters.

I do not recommend this game, I hope no one new plays this game and gives this corporation their hard earned money. I dislike the game's business practices since they infringe on the gameplay and loot available. It's extremely repetitive on the seasonal level as Destiny attempts to be a game you give ALL your time to and its the same thing...every season...Play this game as much as you want but just know that all Bungie's hard work goes to their micro transaction store instead of game play. Save yourself countless hours. The grinds are not worth the highs in comparison to lows. Enjoy as you will I spent like 700 bucks on expansions and dlcs combines since all the days of D1. This game is FPS league of legends. Dont let your friends play it
Nimbus is Destiny 2 Ja Ja Binks.

Don't think I've ever played a fun, exciting game like this that actively suffers from timed content in such a prolific way. There are so many builds that rely on certain weapons that you can't obtain anymore. I'm a returning player who skipped all of Beyond Light Launch and onward until Lightfall, and god it is just so painful to see a cool build or a build that is *required* for some sub-classes to even function well in any meaningful content... And have the weapon that makes the build work require a catalyst that is now a random drop, or you can't even get anymore if you tried. Seasonal weapons have done a great job as the game's life as gone on to address pain points of boring loot and weak rolls, but now a player who has missed even just one season can be behind forever... Now there *are* ways for these weapons to 'come back'. With set rolls on vendors, at random completely indiscernible times for a week at most. I waited for a Calus Mini Tool SMG with demolition and/or Incandescent to be available all the first two seasons of Lightfall for my solar builds (builds that are now much weaker due to season of the deep's mods)... And it just hasn't reappeared. I had to settle for a much less effective weapon and weapon type I could craft just to function on my solar builds. This pattern is repeated with Arc builds this season, where my Thunderlord hasn't gotten a catalyst to drop and I have no good primary/special weapons for arc to use.

Destiny is super fun, really! It's extremely exciting, the effects are all top-notch, enemy design is varied and there is alot of challenging raids and content... But, back when I was playing the game years ago, we didn't have to buy dungeons. We paid less for expansions and seasons, and retained the same amount of content. Now, not only has these been brought up in price, and dungeons now being sold separately from the normal game... Bungie are making more money every year then last. They are making two more brand new games, one of which was just announced. They are not doing this, nickle and diming every last piece of content, to make the game. They are doing it to make a profit. So, as such, these problems amount to alot of frustration. For now, unless you've been playing this game since it started or years prior to this review, avoid at all costs. It's not worth it, period.
Best game I ever played

applist.name: Team Fortress 2
applist.detailed_description:
"The most fun you can have online" - PC Gamer
Is now FREE!
There’s no catch! Play as much as you want, as long as you like!

The most highly-rated free game of all time!
One of the most popular online action games of all time, Team Fortress 2 delivers constant free updates—new game modes, maps, equipment and, most importantly, hats. Nine distinct classes provide a broad range of tactical abilities and personalities, and lend themselves to a variety of player skills.

New to TF? Don’t sweat it!
No matter what your style and experience, we’ve got a character for you. Detailed training and offline practice modes will help you hone your skills before jumping into one of TF2’s many game modes, including Capture the Flag, Control Point, Payload, Arena, King of the Hill and more.

Make a character your own!
There are hundreds of weapons, hats and more to collect, craft, buy and trade. Tweak your favorite class to suit your gameplay style and personal taste. You don’t need to pay to win—virtually all of the items in the Mann Co. Store can also be found in-game.

this game is literally 15+ years old and it's still fun and charming
what else are you looking for?
SHADOW WIZARD MONEY GANG, WE LOVE CASTING SPELLS 🗣️🗣️🗣️💯💯💯
This game deserves more...
They didn't take care of the bot issue.

There are many more things I'd like to mention about this games strengths and what makes it unique, but I'll keep this review concise.

This game is absolutely still worth playing in 2023.

The bot crisis has pretty much been relegated to CTF servers, which is still a shame but it's much better than it being across the board. Also, community servers obviously have zero bots.

What makes me love this game is how different the experience is from any other shooter, even to this day. There are many mechanics/features that I've never seen in any other game before. I think this games biggest strength, which is also a huge factor in enabling this kind of uniqueness, is the emphasis on fun over balance and silly nature of the game which leads to more open minded devs/players.

This isn't an approach that can work for many games, but this game has had about 16 years to refine the experience and it truly shows. Despite how bizarre so many aspects of the game are, the gameplay is quite well balanced, smooth, and has a very high skill ceiling which all combine to make for a very replayable title.

Also, I'd be remissed to not talk about the elephant in the room (Overwatch) so here we go. It's a mistake to consider playing this game pointless because of the existence of Overwatch. As mentioned there are many things in this game that I've never seen in any other game before, and that includes Overwatch. These games are VERY different from each other, and each class in TF2 has much more depth than any class in Overwatch, though Overwatch does have a much larger roster. You can like one game over the other, or you could be a fan of both. They are very different games and one does not negate the others quality.

Haven't played it lately, but TF2 was amazing. Loved how different the classes were, which is something that Overwatch kind of lost over the years. Great map design too!

I'm sure it'll be better once a major update drops.


Which'll never happen.

Game doesn't feel rewarding to play. Every time I have logged into this game, I have logged off angrier and sweater than when I started. If you want to put yourself in a bad mood, just pick any public server and play a couple rounds.

 I WANT to like this game, I want to look at the scoreboard and see my name at the top. I want to win. I want a good K/D ratio, I want to feel like I supported my team, and to feel satisfied after a match. But I don't and I never will. I have over 660 hours in the game and I regularly lose. I get mad. I blame my team mates. I rage. I mald in chat. I change my class, and I still get killed. I get dominated by at least two players per match. in 660 hours and I should have learned SOMETHING but I still just barely outskill a fresh F2P. 

I'm not going to get good at this game, no matter how many more hours I put into this game. I'm just going to keep on losing and dying and getting mad and being salty. Instead of doing that, I'm going to uninstall the game, and try to not play it anymore. There is this small amount of naivety buried deep inside me that says if I just play for a little while longer, I'll get better, but that same voice said that same thing 100 hours ago.

If you want a challenging, teamwork based First Person Shooter, and you can tolerate losing, then this game is perfect for you. If you're akin to me, and want to play games you're skilled at, please, pick something else.
