reviews.review: Cant learn the game because people will just dog you for being new and tell you to kill yourself for not knowing mechanics to a fight worst community I have ever seen no wonder the game is dead

If you feel like losing 8+ hours doing dailies/weeklies, this is the grind for you.
PS. You don't get paid for this second job.
Trash game, 10/10, don't install for better mental health :Classic:

This game is incredibly new-player-unfriendly. The catch up mechanics are irrelevant because it's still weeks worth of solo grinding to get to end-game content, and when you get there, the gatekeeping done by the playerbase makes the game incredibly frustrating. The RNG algorithm was written by a toddler, and RNG is far too prevalent. Nearly every feature of the game was intentionally designed to push players towards the cash shop.

Oh yeah, and don't ignore the fact that literally 70% of this game's active players are bots.
Greedy practices

Can't recommend this game.
It full of problems that devs and publishers haven't solved after more then a year.

If you don't plan to spend lot of time grinding and/or spanding cash in this game don't even bother.

CONS:
- It Not F2P friendly.
- Full of bots for more then a year.
- Inflated economy by RMT and bots.
- P2W.
- 200% FOMO.
- This game want really hard to be your 2nd job but here is a plot twist: you will need to pay them ... .
- Game system are punishing Old players for playing with New players that create one of the most toxic and gatekeeping community that i have ever saw in video game (and i have played League for a while...).
- If you want to play other class build then meta you will get punished by the game and other players.
- Published by AGS that don't care about player.
- Good luck with geting help if something happend (automated AGS support just dont care).
- Amazon's Censorship.

PROS:
- Cool graphic and animations.
- Lot of content to do.
- No that bad story as for ARPG.

BTW: 
I was wating 8 years for this game to hit Global.
Now I hate this Frankenstein's monster what it became :(
What a disappointment it is.
became pay to win on day 6, dont trust amazon to do anything.

The skins, cool, and of course you have to pay for them.
Combat pretty solid. If the combat wasn't so good I would have stopped playing sooner.
Story - barely there. Enough to make you wonder.
Classes - pretty interesting. There is definitely something for everyone certainly. 
Progression system ? absolute balls. If you like having 6 characters to farm *every* single time and want to put in time equivalent to double overtime of a job, then play it as a free to play player, or .. as a lot of others have mentioned. Just keep swiping until you catch up.

I'll put this here just to filter my thoughts out. 
I do play (still unfortunately) since the initial release of the game.
Apologies upfront for any spelling mistakes I make in this text.

CONS:
1. This game is NOT casual/F2P friendly in any way possible even though it might act like it. 
- Yes, even though game does provide you with "a lot" of free stuff to progress your character/s, the overwhelming grind you have to do to actually achieve a "proper" endgame expirience overshadows all of it.
- If you hear that this game feels like "having a new job" sort of way, it is indeed true.
- For each one of these "problems" or lets say non casual friendly "mechanics" I am going to list here, I could make a separate paragraph how it corrupts the whole gameplay expirience:
Gatekeeping, FOMO, Absurd amount of toxicity especially in raids, RNG on casino level,... this is pretty much constant daily expirience for even most of veteran players till this date... 

2. Game design is corrupted to the core with INSANE amount of RNG systems to progress your character. 
- Do not get me wrong here... I like a lot of systems which provide you way to progress... however in this gamem every single one is pretty much full fledged casino expirience... it is RNG fiesta at this point.
- The only thing that has a so called "pity meter" where you are pretty much "garanted" a successful character progression in some period of a time is honing (enchanting your main set of gear).
- Every other character progression system is a predatory RNG system designed for you to spend some cash or spend that "new job" amount of time to be successful and achieve what you aim for. (Yes, MMOs are supposed to be grindy... that completely fine and that also part of why I like this genre... this game however takes this topic to a whole different lvl worth of paragraph itslef.)

3. Things I have already mentioned before such as: Gatekeeping, FOMO, Toxicity, RNG, are not an uncommon occurrence even in MMO genre. However, what I do have to say is that even after thousands of hours spent in different MMOs (and other generes), I had never expirienced these issues to have such a hard impact on the playerbase itself, the game is literaly repulsive to play after a while with all of that negative expirience.

PROS:
1. Great combat!
- The combat this game has is quite an expirience. Every single class does feel unique and well designed it its own way. Combat wise this game is pleasure to play.

2. Immerse endgame PVE expirience. 
- The whole part of raids, "legion raids", that this game offers at endgame is arguably one of the best in whole MMO genre.
- You have to learn certain mechanics to be successful, but its worth it. From cinematic point of view to music... that part is worth of some time to expirience it .

3. Somewhat decent graphics. The asymetric camera point of view is also quite well designed.

Summary:
With all things considered, I just can't and will not recommend this game to any new, casual or F2P player.
In my opinion, the game is great in its own ways with tremendous potential to grow and fix certain issues that players do provide as a feedback. However I do not see that hapenning in any near future or at all to be honest, since many changes that "community" feels like they should be implemented just do colide with that predatory game design they have.
The scale of changes that would have to happen in game to be fun for new players and also keep veteran players invested for longer seems to be to great to actually happen.
It would probably just lose AGS and Smilegates a lot of money generation they got implemented in the game systems and well... nobody likes losing money right?

This game has extremely fun content that I love playing, but this review will focus on the negative side of the game.

There are so many barriers to get to the fun content that new players will have an awful time getting there. The game has an account level system that is an accumulation of the experience from all of your characters combined. People will not accept you into groups if that level is not high enough. The developers are adding catch up mechanics and systems but they do not have any way to help players catch up with experience and an outdated card system in the game that takes months/years to complete due to random chance packs and is becoming a standard requirement in the late game making it hard on new players.

Don't let the single player tag fool you into thinking you can play this game completely solo because you will need to play with other players due to Legion Raids being a requirement to upgrade your gear to experience higher level content. There is plenty of solo content in the game, but that is not the most satisfying and well designed content the game has to offer.

There are outdated monetization systems in the game that people have vocalized their discontent about and the developers refuse to remove them. It is one of the main reasons why the majority of players quit the game and it's not something you will be able to avoid.

Even though the game has great content, I do not recommend this game to new players because of the amount of gate keeping new players experience from the community, and the reason the gate keeping exists is because of the amount of playtime that is required on all of your characters to earn gold and build up that account experience. If you only play one character, you won't have the account level that is acceptable when looking for a party. The global and Korean community has complained and provided solutions to this many times but the developers refuse to update this making this game feel like a tedious second job that you have to play daily for hours.
The grind to get to endgame is terrible, repetitive, and boring.

The core gameplay of Lost Ark is fantastic. The classes have unique power fantasies and are fun, and the legion raids are some of the most fun activities in any MMO I've played. Unfortunately, I can't recommend the game since it's bogged down by everything else.

PHOTOSENSITIVE SEIZURE WARNING YELLING AT YOU EVERY TIME YOU 
START THE GAME.  Seriously--Who would possibly make this kind of decision?
It's beyond idiotic.

It's beyond impossible to catch up to older players.  They nerfed the gold that
people can get from any sort of raid that's actually accessible to a normal player
and you still need gold to buy gear.  This game has a lot of features that could be
great but these recent decisions have really destroyed the enjoyment I had in it.

Good luck.
P2W shit KR game with really good combat.
Why do people hype this game so much. its literally a mobile game, but a lil better and on pc...

Imagine running on legos for a mile, then at the end when the pain is all over, everyone you love is disappointed in you for running ONLY a mile on legos, as you sit there in toe curling pain, bleeding from your feet.

Lost Ark's combat mechanics are the standout feature in an otherwise disappointing experience.
The game is plagued by an overwhelming grind and an artificial progression system that hinders player enjoyment.
Repetitive tasks and arbitrary barriers only serve to make gameplay tedious and frustrating. Sadly, Lost Ark falls short of its potential, leaving players feeling unsatisfied and drained.

How should I put this.... I both love and hate this game
after 4500 hours into the game, spent at least couple thousand dollars, I feel I know enough. I quit the game few months ago mostly due to the amount of time you need. 
They say most games are either pay-to-win or extremely time consuming to keep up with the rest of the community, this game actually requires both...

Pros-
-graphic is decent, characters are very pretty
-game play is nice, requires you to actually know what you are doing with your class/skills etc
-upgrading gear has a pity system so at least you know there is a "end" (even if it costly you tons of gold/material regardless)
-community --this is variable since i started the game since it came out, if you are new, likely it is difficult to keep up and you will likely get yelled at alot

Cons- (two major ones)
-EXTREMELY time consuming, let me tell you why: if you want to just focus on one character (like many other MMORPGS), this game is NOT for you. By having alts, they can contribute to income for resources/gold/material for you to hone. Each character have their own individual daily chaos dungeons/bosses, weekly raids/quests. Looking back, I spent somewhere between 6-8 hours a day playing this just to get daily/weeklies done on 6 characters, that is usually not maintainable for most people with a regular worklife
-RNG system / cost: just spending time doesn't really get you the stuff you need. game has alot of in-game purchases for cosmatics/packs that you kinda need to get cards/honing mats. The game does give out free stuff frequently, but if you want to do the raids as soon as they come out, those will not be nearly enough. So that means if you REALLY want to keep up, more often than not you will need to pay real money for in-game stuff, especially if you are not playing 6-8h+ per day on 6+ alts. 
-some of the raids are really unforgiving, this could be frustrating for alot of people since there is always that ONE person out of eight people that screws up that ONE mechanism and wipe the raid the 50th times at 3AM in the morning.... But this goes back to "you really need to know what you are doing", so it depends on who is reading this. 


Overall, I love the game, but for a REGULAR person, unless you are really casual and just want to do a daily quest/boss kill for fun here and there and don't really care much about anything else, then this game is NOT for you. You really need to be semi-hardcore PLUS willing to spend cash to stay on the front line when raids come out etc.

Fuck gatekeeping raids, even when you're overgeared for them.
Fuck daily grind. 2 chaos dungeons, 2 guardians, every day with every character... fuck that.
And last but not least... 
FUCK PHEONS. 
 - Imagine being forced to buy a currency (with blue crystals or real money) just to pay an absurd fee to send shit to your alts.
 - Imagine having to pay the same fee with the same stupid currency on the Auction House for every piece of gear (even worse, on gear which are heavily dependant on RNG just to be useful. E.g. to cut Stones and Bracelets)
 - AND NOW, IMAGINE HAVING TO DO ALL OF THAT ON EVERY FUCKING CHARACTER YOU WANT TO PLAY.

Just nah.

And also, blah blah blah, Bots bad. Regions and Servers slowly dying.

Again, nah.
Can be fun, but the grind required is insane. If your only just starting, understand that you will never catch up in any meaningful way. Wait for the next big mmo.

applist.name: Hi-Fi RUSH
applist.detailed_description:
Digital Deluxe Edition



Included in the Hi-Fi RUSH Deluxe Edition:

- Hi-Fi RUSH (Base game)
- Two Chai outfits*
- Seven bonus Chai t-shirts
- 808-Themed Guitar Skin
- 808 Alternate Skin
- Gears Starter Pack with 20,000 Gears for unlocking combat skills and other upgrades. (Note: Gears are obtained through combat and exploration in-game and not available as a purchasable currency.)

*Each of the Chai Outfits includes an alternate robot arm, scarf, jacket, trousers and shoes which can be mixed and matched with the other cosmetics in-game

Note: Gears are immediately available after purchase. Players get access to the other items after beating the opening stage and can change their outfits in the Hideout.


About the Game

Feel the beat as wannabe rockstar Chai and his ragtag team of allies rebel against an evil robotics enhancement megacorp with raucous rhythm combat! From Tango Gameworks, the studio that brought you The Evil Within® and Ghostwire®:Tokyo (no, really) comes Hi-Fi RUSH, an all-new action game where the characters, world and combat stylishly sync to the music!

Chai Versus the World


Labeled ‘defective’ after a shady corporate experiment mistakenly fuses a music player to his heart, Chai must now fight for his freedom in a slick animated world where everything – platforming puzzles, enemy attacks and even the colorful gags & banter - are synced to the beat.

Open Up the Mosh Pit!


Take on armies of corporate drones (read: actual robots) in satisfying, rhythm-amplified combat. Time your moves to pull off flashy Beat Hits, hard-hitting special abilities and even combination attacks with your allies! Want to show off? Go further and tap into the beat to amp up your skills and earn those covetous S-rank scores.

Rowdy Rebels Vs. Badass Bosses


Lead a squad of colorful teammates and take the fight to the heart of an, er, heartless corporation. Square off with each department’s boss, from Production to Marketing to Finance, each more ready to protect the company’s bottom line than the last in over-the-top battle sequences accompanied by their own music tracks!

Grab Your Headphones


Tap your toes to a killer mixtape of original music, as well as songs by Nine Inch Nails, The Prodigy, The Joy Formidable and more! Want to show off your skills to a live streaming audience? Fret not: Hi-Fi RUSH includes a streamer-friendly alternate audio mode which replaces those licensed songs with original tracks made especially for streaming Hi-Fi RUSH.

highlighted.name: This will cost you big time
I think I deserve some praise, here!

reviews.review: Hi-Fi RUSH is a reminder that you don't need ultra realistic graphics and physics or open world & a massive multiplayer to be a good game. Playing Hi-Fi RUSH felt like re-playing a timeless classic such as Okami HD, Super Mario 64 or Psychonauts, but made for the modern era. The whole time playing felt like I was watching an interactive comic turned into anime. Before I started to play Hi-Fi RUSH, being a rhythm game I thought only combat would be on a beat, but I was wrong because when I actually started to play it I realised that the ENTIRE WORLD INTERACTIONS ARE SYNCHRONISED TO MUSIC! Mind blowing concept! Gameplay is smooth, art style is fantastic, the soundtrack is awesome & the challenge is superb! My last note is that I did not encounter a single bug or a crash which is a surprise because in the past decade or so, every newly released game was unplayable & some companies took years to fix their products, but not this game. It's truly a flawless masterpiece and I can't praise it enough. Well done Tango Gameworks and Bethesda Softworks, because you made a game that I will fondly remember for ages!
This game feels like that scene in Ratatouille where the food critic flashes back to his childhood 10/10
cat
i wish i had musical robot powers and a cat

An emphatic yes for this game.

I picked it up after seeing a very short combo video from a friend.

Hi-Fi Rush is a brilliant, brilliant game. Amazing VO. Fantastic writing/narrative design. Solid combat. Fun levels. TONS of feel good moments. I wish I could re-experience this game again for the first time. 

What a gem.

[h1] Hi-Fi Rush REVIEW:[/h1] 

[b]Hi-Fi Rush[/b] is a rhythm-based action game developed by [b]Tango Gameworks[/b] and published by [b]Bethesda Softworks[/b] for the [b]Windows and Xbox Series X/S platforms[/b] and right off the bat, this game GOT ME JAMMING to that wonderful composed soundtrack which was created by former Konami composer [u]Shuichi Kobori[/u], former Capcom composer [u]Reo Uratani[/u], and Tango Gameworks' sound designer [u]Masatoshi Yanagi[/u]. It have ten licensed music tracks throughout the story and all of them fits perfect to where you at in the game right now and the boss fights. I can guarantee you 100$ or more that you will jam to one of these soundtracks FOR SURE. The [b]Gameplay[/b] is rhythm-based where you will need to perfect time hit a button to perform QTE or just the combat of this game and i appreciate that in this game it is not necessary to perfect time every hit thanks to the design of the rhythmic traits ( except few must needed parts which are pretty easy ). Even in order to help you find your rhythm, the whole world of Hi-Fi Rush pulses with the beat of whatever music is currently playing, providing you with both visual and audio cues for nailing its timing.You get different skills / combat moves as you progress through the game and they are easy to learn through good tutorial for each of them. The [b]Story[/b] of Hi-Fi rush is also very well written and keeps you entertain throughout the time you spend on it. It starts off with [spoiler] [b]Chai[/b], a 25-year old man with a disabled right arm and a dream to become a rockstar, arrives at the Vandelay Technologies campus to volunteer for Project Armstrong, a test program for cybernetic limb replacement. Unbeknownst to Chai, the CEO, Kale Vandelay secretly designates Chai to be a garbage collector for the company’s waste management [/spoiler] and how you go on from there ( pacing ) is well done IMO. It is a straightforward story BUT there are fun twist and turns throughout it. Other than that the [b]Boss fights[/b] were super fun to beat and the characters are REALLY REALLY well written, fun to hang around with, to learn about them and [b]Chai, the main hero of this game [/b] is super well voice acted, funny and just you just get to love him in this game. The game looks visually stunning to look at. Performance is also super well optimized with me having 60fps throughout it and you can get above that also with powerful GPU

[b]OVERALL, Hi-Fi Rush Shadow-dropping tactic by [u]Tango Gameworks[/u] was a very brilliant and smart move and this game is a MUST-PLAY if you are into listening / jamming to good soundtrack and rhythm-based games, Worth all the price of it ( or play it on Gamepass which makes is 2 times worth it )[/b]

[h2]Game Link:[/h2]
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1817230/HiFi_RUSH/

[url=https://www.xbox.com/en-US/games/hi-fi-rush] Hi-Fi Rush on GamePass [/url]
It's FLCL meets Devil May Cry with Jet Set Radio's artstyle. What more could you ask?

Timeless art direction.
Great characters that are well written and actually made me laugh.
Fun rhythm-based gameplay that offers a solid challenge, especially on hard mode.
Fantastic music, whether it be songs they licensed or songs they wrote.

All in all, this game is 100% worth picking up, even for full price.
wish i  had a robotic metal hand and a cattt
10/10, great gameplay and great vibes
11/10 I can feel sound

This was soreley needed if in today's gaming landscape if you miss bright and fun and simpler times.The game world projects beat for you to follow so even if you have to left feet you can play pick up and follow.well done to the dev team and i don't say that often.
HOLY ENDORHPINE BOZO BLAST HATRED MAN KILL! KILL! SEX OVERDRIVE JOE BIDEN FLASK OPEN CASKET MONKLEY CEREMONUY JAZZ PEROFROMANCE HAND TO BAND VOMIT JOLLY RANCHE
They made a good videogame; in current year!

Disclaimer: I got this game while it was on sale, however I would buy it at full price in a heartbeat!

It kinda shocked the heck out of me when the announcement for this game dropped just out of the blue and it was playable the same day! This game is outstanding and deserves even more love than it gets already!

From the devs that made... *checks notes* THE EVIL WITHIN?!? Daaaaaaaaamn their comedy and art direction in this is S-Tier! The game plays like an old Gamecube/PS2/OG-Xbox era action platformer, with rhythm attributes in the mix. You can tell that a lot of love went into this game, from the stage design, combat feel, to the voice acting. This game has charm in spades and then some, and runs really well too!

I've only rarely encountered minor stuttering, but it's not enough to detract from the experience. It's only really happened to me when I was in a traversal segment and there's not much going on anyhow. Other than that, it's been completely bug-free so far.

Also, one of the big bads is a reference to Jojo's Bizarre Adventure and the weeb in me squeals with delight. I also love the nods to The Evil Within with some robo-ified Sebastian and Joseph cameos.

This game honestly deserves your money even at full price. The amount of detail and love put into this game is insane and exactly what the industry needs in this day and age!

I don't typically leave reviews, but this game is absolutely awesome. Didn't have so much fun with any game for so long. Brilliant graphic design and and a vibrant world. The only week point is in-game lore of notes and messages that i din't find interesting to read, but who cares honestly, because everything else is top notch.
RAHHHHHHHH BUY THE FUCKING GAMEEE, MY BOOTYHOLE CLENCEHED SO TIGHT PLAYING THIS GAME RAHHHHHHHHH
Haven't seen characters that make me smile in a while

This game is as if you're playing a Bionic Commando version of the movie Baby Driver in a Borderlands X Sunset OverDrive game. Very fun for even the most novice beat oriented platformer players. The reviews speak for themselves, awesome game overall and a nice change of pace having beats induce combat!

applist.name: STAR WARS Jedi: Survivor™
applist.detailed_description:
STAR WARS Jedi: Survivor™ Deluxe Edition

Unlock exclusive cosmetic items inspired by Han Solo™ and Luke Skywalker™, as seen in STAR WARS: A New Hope, with Star Wars Jedi: Survivor Deluxe Edition*.

  • The “Galactic Hero” Cosmetic Pack includes:
    • “Scoundrel” Cosmetic
    • “Rugged” BD-1 Cosmetic
    • "DL-44” Blaster Set

  • The “New Hero” Cosmetic Pack includes:
    • “Rebel Hero” Cosmetic
    • “BD-Astro” BD-1 Cosmetic
    • “Rebel Hero” Lightsaber Set


About the Game

The story of Cal Kestis continues in Star Wars Jedi: Survivor™, a third-person, galaxy-spanning, action-adventure game from Respawn Entertainment, developed in collaboration with Lucasfilm Games. This narratively driven, single-player title picks up 5 years after the events of Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order™ and follows Cal’s increasingly desperate fight as the galaxy descends further into darkness. Pushed to the edges of the galaxy by the Empire, Cal will find himself surrounded by threats new and familiar. As one of the last surviving Jedi Knights, Cal is driven to make a stand during the galaxy’s darkest times — but how far is he willing to go to protect himself, his crew, and the legacy of the Jedi Order?

subs.option_text: STAR WARS Jedi: Survivor™ Deluxe Edition - $89.99

reviews.review: Have not been able to launch the game since EA's outage on May 4th. The fact that a single player game needs an internet connection to begin with is idiotic.
A single crash corrupted my 140 hour 99.8% NG+ save file.

Jedi Survivor is an amazing game and takes everything the first game did and does it even better, worlds are far more expansive and have much more enemy variety. Character customisation is also much better in this game, not just for cosmetics but for gameplay as well. Fallen Order has 3 skill tree pathways whereas Survivor starts you off with 7, with 2 more unlocking later in the game. I found myself struggling to choose between the different upgrades which was much better than the far more linear skill tree of Fallen Order.

While the game itself is great the technical issues are just so bad. At first I thought I was getting alright performance, like around 40+ frames at 1080p, but it just got so much worse, going anywhere between 10-30 frames at 720p medium settings. Plus the game bugs out on the visuals and goes all black and white and all weird, plus the Mogu is so annoying cause if you die to it, all your xp disappears.

I love this game but it has some serious issues, I just can't recommend it

I tried my hardest to make due and ignore the crashes and bugs and just put it down to "hey it happens". But to have the game crash mid cut-scene after a stupid hard/buggy boss, not saving and forcing me to go back through that. 

No. Just NO. 

That is my limit.
Its not even the first time this has happen. Not to mention the roll on the dice If my dlc is working or not. Plus the mandatory need for internet connection for the SINGLE PLAYER Game.

 I received an error message at one point telling me that because the game couldn't connect to EA's servers my save file couldn't be verified, that I should wait 5 minutes or I run the risk of losing my save. 

What on earth is that.

 I want to love this, I tried to, I even tried convincing my friends that its not so bad, but god EA has made that impossible. 

It feels like the game had need to prove me wrong. 

Well guess what, I was wrong, It is that bad.

 I'm done.
Releasing a game in this state should constitute as fraud,
The game is still stuttering like no tomorrow. Don't buy it until it's actualy a game.
I don't recommend this game until it's fixed. The gameplay itself is great, but so far it's crashed 3 times in less than 2 hours. I'm considering if I'd want to refund or wait it out, just be warned.

131 Hours. Beat the story twice on the 2 hardest difficulties. Unlocked all achievements and got my original save file to 100% completion (dont recommend, very tedious but im a completionist). Story was a 9.6/10 for me. Game play and world is a huge step up from the previous, a solid 9/10 for me. Respawn makes incredible single player games. I wish EA was not the publisher however, they rushed the launch before a optimized PC port was fine tuned, resulting in performance issues for most. Since launch a couple of patches have improved performance, however ray traying at the time of this review will still likely cause crashes. And the EA app needed to run the game can be a pain. 

A must play if you are a fan of star wars.

Cons: fps issues
Pros: Rick the door Tech
Incredibly good story, performance issues are still present but the game itself is phenomenal

The gameplay is an improvement from the fallen order. However the constant crashes and dlc missing from the game 90% of thee time are unacceptable and have gotten worse with the recent patch. I just lost my 28 hour save at the end of the game due to the crashes corrupting the save file. I have no desire to restart my play through now.

As mentioned in the hundreds and hundreds of reviews. This game is awesome and a DISASTER !!! However, i have to give this a complete thumbs down and will be requesting a refund until the issues are worked out. My personal opinion, this game was released way before the kinks and bugs were addressed. And the fact that you have to have internet in order to play the game is just all out RIDICULOUS !!!!! We have paid good money for this game and should be able to play it when we want, where we want, and should not have to worry about internet !!! You really need to re-think and correct your ERROR.....

very fun and nice improvement from previous game

had to do a few things to stop game crashing but eventually i got it to work and i have already been staying up late to play more 

a few things i did to fix crashes is 

i updated my drivers 

then i forced my pc to run the game on my Gpu instead of cpu by going to settings then display then browse then finding jedi survivor then when game is in list click options then set to high performance or preffered gpu
then i went to steam/steamapps/common/jedi survivor/swgame/binaries/win64 then clicked on .exe application once to highlight it then right clicked went to properties then compatability and checked box for disable fullscreen optimizations 

and after all that my game worked 

but i am not playing on highend pc im on a gaming laptop with 32 gb ram 2060 rtx card and i7 9th gen processor i am also running game on a 2 tb nvme ssd not a hard drive

hopefully this helps anyone trying to think of what to do to fix game or atleast help you know what to look up for troubleshooting

**READ IF PERFORMANCE IS YOUR MAIN CONCERN**
Many reviews are negative due to severe performance issues, which absolutely was a huge problem. The first time they released an update that supposedly helped PC performance, it didn't really do much. However, after the most recent patch I noticed a significantly better play experience. I would like to see these negative reviews edited to reflect on their current performance so that we can see how others might have been helped (or not helped) by recent updates, since I personally am having a great time.

I play on maximum settings at 1440p and get a solid 60-100 fps everywhere in the game now.

My Specs:
CPU: Ryzen 3700x
GPU: 3060 Ti
RAM: 16GB
Windows 10

I have had a wonderful experience with Jedi Survivor. If you are a fan of the first game, the sequel improves upon nearly every piece. Customization is far more varied, there are now five entirely different lightsaber stances (dual-wielding is my personal favorite), combat feels satisfying and powerful, and the level design is absolutely gorgeous. Also, there are far more skills to gain as you level up, making progression much more interesting in my opinion. As with the first one, I felt genuinely invested in the story, and most of the characters have so much heart.

Again, if you like Star Wars and/or liked Fallen Order, this is genuinely a fantastic game to buy (and certainly better than most of EA's Star Wars).
EA developers are a menace to society.

The fact that I invested over $3,300 into a rig, solely purpose of gaming, that has a 6800XT paired with a 5900X and can't hit 60 frames at 1080 with mid settings speaks just to how poor the optimization of this game is. EA will never stop pressuring developers with crunch-times and deadlines just so that they can pander to investors and shareholders about how much progress they're making while actually doing none of the work. 

It is impossible for me to look past the glaring optimization issues, crashes, EA's malware (or launcher, depending on how you look at it), and enjoy the game for what it was meant to be. Why? Because it only works half the time, at least for most people. With the release of patch #5 as of May 17th, people are reporting even WORSE performance, and I respect myself enough to choose to not deal with issues that never should've been there to begin with. The whole thing is just one huge disappointment - for STAR WARS fans, for Fallen Order fans, for Souls-like fans, and for consumers everywhere. 

This game is a prime example of how far publishers are willing to go to actively sabotage the consumer's enjoyment of a product that they never worked to help create by doing everything they could to make sure it was released in an unfinished, or otherwise un-optimized state for the pursuit of nothing but profits regardless of the measures or means to do so. EA would probably kill younglings if it meant they'd turn a profit. 

Do not buy.

Well, this started off more poorly than I expected and for a reason that I dont see talked about much in other reviews. After dropping the $70 for the game, I was forced to download additional software to my PC in order to play the game, in addition to the Origin software I had from previous EA games. You may not think its a bit deal, but this software is by definition malware as its software I did not seek out, it is taxing to my system via background processes and is by design extremely difficult to eliminate. Seriously, check the end user agreement as they even openly state multiple links to various websites, including third party websites, for instructions at only removing part of the software before capping it off by saying that you will still have to eliminate remaining software manually from your local files. This is, frustrating, that a company can get away with such business practices and I have doubts about how legal this practice actually is. However, the damage is done for me at least, but buyer beware. 

Oh, I am also seeing frame rate drops even in just menus, but the game is otherwise playable in case you were just looking for that.

mal·ware
noun
software that is specifically designed to disrupt, damage, or gain unauthorized access to a computer system.
Until i can run the game even at a stable 60 fps on my 4080, you get thumbs down, shouldn't have been released yet

[h1]"Tell me, Cal Kestis... Why lead when they won't follow? Why fight when you can't win? What is your next move, Jedi?"[/h1]

[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Star Wars Jedi: Survivor is the third-person action-adventure sequel to the original Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order, as it follows the story of Cal Kestis, an orphaned Jedi struggling to survive in an Empire-ruled galaxy that seeks his demise. While toiling with emotions such as love, loss, and rage, he must navigate the complex path before him with the hope, he will not lose himself along the way. Ignite your lightsaber, unholster your blaster and take on the galaxy to prove you are a survivor too.

[table]
[tr]
	[th][b]🟩 Positives[/b][/th]
	[th][b]🟥 Negatives[/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td]🟩 The combat formula has been stunningly improved in nearly every facet to provide a far smoother and more intuitive experience than ever before. The addition of some new stances and skills allows you to customise your combat style in numerous ways giving a greater sense of freedom than ever before.

🟩 Speaking of customisation, you have a plethora of choices in the realm of aesthetic options, from hair and beard styles and attire to lightsaber styles and colours.

🟩 Jedi: Survivor is the most graphically pleasing and ambitious single-player Star Wars game ever created. It is gorgeous in nearly every regard and precisely captures that power experience everyone hopes for with a new Star Wars game.

🟩 On the same spectrum as the visual aesthetics, the audio is simply outstanding. The soundtrack is a perfect combination of both; old and new melodies that harmonise perfectly against the world's atmosphere and overall ambience. All of the above is coupled nicely with the passionate voice-acting team that elevates the experience to the next level.[/td]
	[td]🟥 While I didn't experience a lot of technical issues with Jedi: Survivor, I am not without empathy for the large majority who did. The game was and is still riddled with many bugs and infrequent crashing [/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[h1]Story[/h1]
Star Wars Jedi: Survivor takes place between Episodes three and four of the movies and five years after the events of Fallen Order. Cal Kestis has come to terms with the events that transpired in the first game, but his crew has split up and gone their separate ways, forcing Cal to seek a new team to take on the Empire. This quickly turns to chaos as the Inquisitors who plagued Cal in the first game continue their hunt for him, and the story begins to unravel from there.

Cal begins his journey anew with the hope that he may find some familiar faces as he struggles with both the loss of friends and the anger that burns deeply against the Empire that took them. With his trusty robot companion, BD-1 by his side, Cal must take the fight to the Empire, and discover victory and betrayal along the way.

But in the end will he stay true to himself and the ways of the Jedi or will he give in to his anger and hate and become the thing he's hated all this time?

[h1]Gameplay Analysis[/h1]
[b]An elegant weapon for a more civilised age.[/b]
A large majority of your experience with SWJS will be combat against both weak and formidable foes, so it feels like an apt place to start. The combat here is flawless, the movement is fluid, and the controls are responsive. Each combat stance provides a very different experience as well; dual lightsabers are very fast and powerful but lack defence and range, and double-ended lightsabers, however, are slightly slower and less powerful but deliver a lot more protection.

Combat also consists of force powers. Cal isn't the most force-capable or powerful Jedi to ever exist, he does have access to its potential, allowing him to push and pull enemies, throw his lightsaber and use his unique ability, which lets him slow down time and lets him pick apart enemies.

To further improve Cal's ability to fight, you are able to spend skill points that you earn from combat and exploration that can vastly change abilities making them more effective in certain situations. You can respec these skills at the cost of skill points, providing some additional freedom in the decisions.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2973080301

[b]Do or do not. There is no try.[/b]
The planets are substantial in size and provide a lot of scope for exploration and discovery. You won't ever have to go off the beaten path for a story mission, but there are several side missions and events for diligent explorers to uncover. These will often reward you with unique items or a permanent stat boost, making them well worth the time and effort. Exploring the environment will also provide you with more fast-travel locations that make future exploration significantly less tedious.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2973080372

[b]Your focus determines your reality.[/b]
On top of the already substantial combat and skill choices you can make in the game, you also receive a repertoire of character customisation options that allow you to change the look of Cal and his equipment. These can include hair and beard lengths and styles to the type of clothes he wears and the colours of it and the shape and look of his lightsaber.

This is where exploration truly takes prominence, as many of the best customisation options are only available through exploration, by finding the scattered rare materials or as items hidden in the deepest, darkest recesses across the worlds.

[h1]Audio and Visual[/h1]
The visual aesthetic of SWJS is simply sensational. Never before has a Star Wars game immersed me so perfectly into its world from a visual standpoint than this title did. The environments have been passionately created and developed to be expansive and breathtaking.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2968582682

This is also true of the soundtrack and overall audio ambience, where every region has its own beautifully developed soundtrack to contrast its environment and aura flawlessly. The voice acting here is probably amongst the best I've experienced in a game to this very day.

[h1]PC Performance and Specifications[/h1]
With everything set as high as it goes at 2560 x 1440 resolution, the game ran exceptionally well for the most part. There are a lot of consistent bugs in the game, and it did crash infrequently.
🟧 Many, many bugs still plague this game.
🟧 The game crashes infrequently regardless of the graphical settings.
🟨 The game requires file optimisation every time it launches, which can become tedious.
RAM: 32GB (Under Load Usage: 40%)
CPU: i9 10900KA 3.70GHz (Under Load Usage: 53.5%)
GPU: MSI Ventus RTX 3080 (Under Load Usage: 42%)

[h1]Final Thoughts - Very Good[/h1]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2529084785]Review chart here.[/url]
Star Wars Jedi: Survivor is hands down amongst the best Star Wars games I've ever played. It does so many things exceptionally well and improves upon nearly every facet of the original game. This is all, unfortunately, let down by the poor launch conditions and copious quantities of bugs and glitches still present in the title. This is very likely my GOTY so far, I just wish more players had a better time with it. It’s definitely worth a shot, but it still requires some time in the oven. 

[quote]Close your eyes Jedi, and let the force guide you to [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/43064204/] Hell, Purgatory and Paradise[/url], where you will begin to understand the true powers of the force.[/quote]

This is a really hard game to rate right now. It really is an incredible game with many upgrades over Fallen Order. Unfortunately, there are massive performance issues right now. Its really frustrating why they didn't include DLSS 2/3 as an option for people to use in this game. Nvidia sponsored games most of the time have both FSR and DLSS options. It seems though that AMD will not allow or discourages DLSS to be used in their sponsored games. Completely absurd!

I do recommend this game, as it is really incredible.....but be warned......unless you have a pretty recent gaming computer you are likely to have severe performance issues until this game is fixed.

applist.name: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online
applist.detailed_description:
Take part in an epic and ever-changing FINAL FANTASY as you adventure and explore with friends from around the world. This product also includes the entitlements to play FINAL FANTASY® XIV: A Realm Reborn and the expansion pack FINAL FANTASY® XIV: HEAVENSWARD.

For newcomers to FINAL FANTASY XIV Online, the Starter Edition includes two award-winning titles – FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn, and the first expansion, FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward.

Join over 25 million adventurers worldwide on an adventure that will take you to the heavens and beyond!

Includes 30-day free subscription period for all newly created service accounts*. User registration and service subscription are required to play the game.

* The 30-day free play period included with purchase can only be applied once to each platform on a single service account. Moreover, this 30-day free play period is not applicable to platforms on which a license has already been registered.

LOGO ILLUSTRATION: © 2010, 2014, 2016, 2018, 2021 YOSHITAKA AMANO

Note:
FINAL FANTASY XIV Online game packages available on Steam may only be registered and added on a Square Enix account that has the base game “FINAL FANTASY XIV Online Starter Edition" (or formerly known as "FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn”) purchased on Steam.

To view your 20 digit registration codes after purchase, simply right-click on “FINAL FANTASY XIV” in your Steam “Library” and select “View CD key” on the Steam client. The codes will always be accessible from this location should you ever need to reference them again.

The registration codes can be redeemed immediately on the Mog Station http://sqex.to/Msp. If this is your first time installing and registering "FINAL FANTASY XIV Online", you may redeem your registration codes during the initial installation process.

reviews.review: yeah it's alright
Met my wife on this game, now we are expecting and happily married. We play as two lalafells and do the savage raids.

Review in english/pt-br.
Análise em inglês/pt-br.

Did you know that the critically acclaimed MMORPG Final Fantasy XIV has a free trial, and includes the entirety of A Realm Reborn AND the award-winning Heavensward expansion up to level 60 with no restrictions on playtime? Sign up, and enjoy Eorzea today!

Jokes aside, it is critically acclaimed for a reason. This game really is what people say it is. All you gotta do is allow yourself to get immersed into this world, just like we used to do when we were kids playing our first MMO's.

The adventures, the time spent, the friends made along the way, the music, the art, everything. This game has a little thing for every kind of player and whenever you think you got the hang of it, you learn 10 new mechanics that challenge you in awesome ways and keep you engaged.

I never thought I'd have this much fun in an MMO after Maple Story and Archeage, but here I am, 1000 hours in and thirsting for more. Every new content release is a breath of fresh air and the community is simply the greatest I have ever met on the internet. Full of helping hands, curious people, new sprouts (as I once was!) and thrill seekers. Of course there are some bad folks here and there, but c'mon, nothing is perfect. XIV gets close, tho.

If you are reading this, it means I got your attention with the feelings, and my friend, you're in for quite the ride. Join this world and let yourself enjoy every second of it. Don't rush, don't skip stuff, don't pressure yourself. If you want it to be, it'll be a smooth ride, so ride along.

10/10. No doubt.

PT-BR:

Você sabia que o criticamente aclamado MMORPG Final Fantasy XIV tem uma Free Trial e inclui A Realm Reborn completo e a premiada expansão Heavensward até o nível 60, sem restrições de tempo de jogo? Inscreva-se e aproveite Eorzea hoje!

Brincadeiras à parte, é aclamado pela crítica por um motivo. Esse jogo é realmente o que as pessoas dizem que é. Tudo o que você precisa fazer é se permitir mergulhar neste mundo, assim como a gente costumava fazer quando era criança jogando nossos primeiros MMOs.

As aventuras, o tempo gasto, os amigos feitos pelo caminho, a música, a arte, tudo. Este jogo tem uma coisinha pra cada tipo de jogador e sempre que você acha que pegou o jeito, aprende 10 novas mecânicas que te desafiam de maneiras incríveis e o te deixam preso no jogo.

Nunca pensei que me divertiria tanto em um MMO depois de Maple Story e Archeage, mas cá estou, 1000 horas depois e sedento por mais. Cada patch novo é um sopro de ar fresco e a comunidade é simplesmente a melhor que já conheci na internet. Cheio de mãos amigas, pessoas curiosas, novos sprouts (como eu já fui!) e caçadores de emoções. Claro que tem gente ruim aqui e ali, mas vamo lá né, nada é perfeito. Mas FF chega perto.

Se você tá lendo isso, significa que chamei sua atenção com os sentimentos e, meu amigo, você tá prestes a pegar a montanha russa. Vem pra esse mundo e se permita aproveitar cada segundo dele. Não se apresse, não pule as coisas, não se pressione. Se você quiser, será um passeio tranquilo, então vamo embarcar nessa.

10/10. Sem dúvida.

Till the sea swallows all!

Out of all video games I've played, this is my favorite video game ever. I've become very emotionally attached to the several characters and especially Emet-Selch. Heavensward, ShadowBringers, and Endwalker expansions was truly one of a kind experience, unforgettable moments. 

Well come and well met, my brave little spark. Walk free, for you are free
It will not let me log in no matter what I do. I changed my password FIVE times and it will not let me reenter my ID so I just can't log in anymore. Great system.

While this game is capable of being entertaining and mildly interesting in the later sections, the effect is diluted by how long it takes to painstakingly trudge through. Anyone interested in starting out or pulled in by the free trial should be aware that getting to any current content will take months, months you continuously pay for. I went from the middle of ARR to the Endwalker finale in 10 months with a fairly heavy time investment. 

The mantra of FF14 is Waste Your Time, and it shows. There are no puzzles or moments of actual mental engagement to break up the drudgery. You are instructed to go to fixed points in the world, read a conversation. Go to a fixed point, obtain an item, go back and read a conversation. Player input is moving to pre-determined locations and reading unvoiced dialogue. You will be given nonsense tasks at every possible opportunity. Progressing the main quest is like slow-walking through chest-high molasses. Even by the time you're the most recognisable hero on the planet, you will be given menial tasks of no more depth than 'go here, then no back' as a completely undisguised timewasting measure. 

The combat experience is completely inorganic and will have to staring at your enormous hotbar rather than looking at the action onscreen. You'll look at the cooldowns, the enemy's AOE telegraph, your teammates' health. The gameplay experience whittles down to solely the UI and blindness to anything else. You can't dodge, you roll out a rotation, if you're standing in an AOE, you slowly traipse out of it, and the attack animations are not synced with the damage being dealt. If you left the AOE, ran halfway across the arena and are nowhere near the boss, you'll still get hit and die when its attack animation finally plays. It's disjointed and incredibly frustrating. 

All dungeons have the exact same formula. Kill some trash mobs (no skipping), fight a boss, x3. They had to invent bosses with little to no relevance to the dungeon you're in just to fill time, and 7 times out of 10, the final one will be a naked woman.

The world maps are completely empty and there's no reason to be in them. There are some engaging visuals for sure - cliffscapes marred by frozen crystal explosions, red flowers spearing up through a rainforest, a forest of nothing but purple blossoms. But there are no activities, secrets, or emergent narrative threads present in the open maps. There's no immersive worldbuilding, and no voiced dialogue. You float through them with the background soundtrack and nothing else to tether you to the world. Every time you unlock a new map, you have to complete several quests on foot before you can fly on your mount again.

ARR is an absolute slog of bloated old content and masked generic bad guys. It's difficult to retain information about the overarching plot, even if you shotgun the entire storyline all at once, because of the sheer length of time it takes to get through. Heavensward brings in a few interesting aspects and has better characters, but is still paced as slowly as possible. The whole game tends to have a lighting problem that makes everything seem murky. 

Stormblood is where fun goes to die. The story becomes increasingly realistic in tone, to the point where it barely deserves the title Final 'Fantasy'. At the same time, the plot beats become absurd. You decide to go to the other side of the world, get on a ship, and have to play a whole dungeon about your random ship encounter that has no effect on anything. A woman is revealed to have been her own secret sister for no reason, puts on an overly revealing outfit, and becomes a war general despite not doing anything or having any experience. Everyone celebrates the defeat of the three main villains and none of them have actually died. 

The game is obsessed with pretending a character has died. There are so many fakeout deaths and so few actual losses felt that I ended up maintaining zero sense of suspense about anything. There was no real tension to a potential loss, no reason to ever believe these characters were in danger. The pretense of acting like it will string along the player's disbelief is alike to jingling a set of keys. 

Antagonists need to be killed three or four times. Many of them will 'corpse pilot' another dead NPC, so along with trying to focus through the overlong, inexplicably complicated lore, you have to bear in mind which character is ACTUALLY inhabiting the body of another at multiple points. The worldbuilding of this game hinges on the discovery of dynamis, a form of energy generated by Feelings that can change reality, and that is the basis for the plot itself - high emotion, dramatic reveals, cinematic deaths, all underpinned by a vague nonsense that never clarifies. Half the time an important boss fight will occur in space for no real reason. 

Shadowbringers is a slight turning point where the game earns the right to be a Final Fantasy title. Scenery finally emerges from its boring cocoon of realism. The story unfolds in a satisfying, if formulaic, way.

Endwalker is our fourth foray into a world-ending crisis, and by this point, the tension levels are stale. The characters do attempt to have a little more personality, and this is a thousand hours in. The first half is more of the same heavy, plodding lore dumps. However, the second half suddenly elevates the story to something genuinely exciting and enjoyable. Answers come thick and fast, foreshadowing and reincorporation take the stage, and overall the experience becomes a heady milkshake to sink the mind into. Elpis proves that despite the meandering plot, a kernel of worthwhile fiction could be found, and also that they DO know how to properly light a map so you can see colours. 

The absolutely massive length of time it took to get to those is what keeps me from recommending the game. For most of the playtime, the ascians are hooded, masked, robed, indistinguishable nuisances with no motivation worth opposing. The justification for your heroics exists on the same level as Kingdom Hearts writing - there is Darkness, and that is bad, and we didn't write anything specific. But it's Bad and you are Good, and your are Light, and the Darkness is bad. You're the world's most generic protagonist, prevailing over the Generic Concept Of Bad, being cheered on by thinly-characterised allies who think you'll explode if they don't praise the player roughly every 8 seconds. 

The only reliable thing about the plot is that doesn't care whether it makes sense as long as the effect is dramatic. Zenos sits on his fat ass for an entire expansion, kills *himself*, but doesn't die, and gets his soul back into his body for no given reason I can remember. They constantly invent a strange and flimsy reason why other players arrive to complete dungeons or trials, when this just calls attention to the fact it's nonsensical. A major character gives up his life force to send the player back in time with a dire warning to not change anything, but the player canonically manages to do this again, repeatedly, just to like, mess with stuff. Zenos walked up to your friends during the apocalypse and said 'hey use all your remaining power to send me to the end of the universe so I can kill the protagonist' and, for some reason, they all went 'yeah okay'. Just so that Zenos can usurp the concept of entropy as the entire story's final boss, in spite of him being completely meaningless, a villain for the sake of having one, a guy who just Opposes You because... because. 

There are better games. There are better MMOs. Play this one if you want, sure. I hope you have a great time. Just be aware that they will pad your playtime for as long as possible, leaving you to subsist on breadcrumbs over a year-long endeavor to catch up. If you want to pay for access to this game for that long, go for it. But go for it in full awareness that you'll be committing to a time investment like no other. o7
Lol

As much as I believe that this is one of the best MMO titles on the market, I cannot recommend it. The subscription service model works games that are consistently getting free new content, but a game like FF14 that gets full 60$ expansions and still expects its playerbase to pay 12$ per month to play the game is not a healthy or consumer-friendly business model. If you do not have endless money to throw down the Square Enix hole, do not buy this game, you will be unable to play it after a month. There's a free trial that you can play to see if you like the game, but I don't recommend ever buying the full game, and especially not the DLC if you aren't absolutely sure that you'll end up playing the game. I cannot get a refund on the 80$ I've spent on this game in total despite now being unable to play the game for several years and I cannot play the free version because I've purchased the game. 

I DO like this game, it's just literally unplayable for me unless I spend an additional 12$ every month. Do not buy this as a new player, get the free trial and play that.

The game itself is incredibly fun: there is something for everyone. But for me it’s always been the people: I have made friends & enemies for life, and even seen plenty of irl relationships start within FFXIV. The amount of impact this game has had on my life cannot be understated. Yet I barely knew anything about MMO’s or Final Fantasy before this. Nearly any other game is just a fun way to pass the time for me, but this one will always feel like home.

By most metrics the best tab-target MMORPG on the market, but caveat emptor - this is a JRPG with an MMO included, rather than an MMO with the RPG mechanics just tacked-on. It cares about story, character, narrative setup and payoff, is remarkable both in terms of visual style and musical choices, and remains a remarkably earnest product in an otherwise very cynical market. Leave preconceived notions, cynicism and bitterness behind and give it a go honestly and with an open heart and you'll not be disappointed. Go into it with a suspicious and adversarial mindset and you might have a better time elsewhere.

While ARR isn't particularly special in terms of storyline and gameplay, virtually everything beyond that - including Heavensward which is a part of the free trial - steps up the quality immensely, leading to an unmissable experience. You owe it to yourself to go through the journey the game places in front of yourself. You will not leave it the same person you went in. I often find that there are two kinds of FFXIV players - ones who never made it past ARR, and the ones who preach the game's virtues from the rooftops like it's the second coming. 

Yes, it's an amazing game. Yes, you should play it. But it's also a pretty serious commitment. The reason why it isn't for everyone is because not everyone can give it the benefit of the doubt and not everyone can approach an earnest piece of media and let go of all the cynical and adversarial systems that recent gaming has seemed to cling to. 

If you do give it a go, it will reward you. You, the player. The human being who feels sorrow and joy, experiences suffering and triumph, goes through weal and woe. Leave as few barriers between yourself and the things it puts in front of you and you'll be well-treated.

Incidentally, this is just my playtime just since command-lining -issteam stopped working. I used to play it off steam for several years more.

Well made and certainly more future-proof than most other ageing MMOs, but there’s only so many half-naked children and wolf-human hybrids one can stomach before hastily catching a plane back to reality from this virtual Akihabara nightmare.
good MMO :)

Very immersive, great story, tons to do, everything feels and looks so good!
Got stuck in Limsa with some "cat girls" and now I owe the mob 284 million gil. Wouldn't recommend.

applist.name: STAR WARS™: The Old Republic™
applist.detailed_description:
STAR WARS™: The Old Republic™ is the only massively multiplayer online game with a Free-to-Play option that puts you at the center of your own story-driven STAR WARS™ saga. Play as a Jedi, a Sith, a Bounty Hunter, or as one of many other iconic STAR WARS roles and explore the galaxy far, far away over three thousand years before the classic films. With 6 narrative expansions, become the hero of your own STAR WARS adventure as you choose your path down the Light or Dark side of the Force™.

Create your legacy. Make meaningful choices throughout your journey and become the hero of your personal STAR WARS saga. The game includes an interactive storyline with cinematic dialogue and full voiceover for all in-game characters.

A growing world awaits. For more than 10 years, players have been able to live out their own STAR WARS stories. With the most recent Onslaught expansion, STAR WARS: The Old Republic continues to deliver ongoing content through regular updates.

8 Unique Stories, 16 Combat Styles. Do you prefer the elegance of a lightsaber or the reliability of a good blaster by your side? Choose from one of 8 iconic, unique storylines, allowing you to create your own personal STAR WARS story. The Legacy of the Sith Expansion also introduces Combat Styles! Players can now separate their Class Story from gameplay style for an even greater customization experience. This frees up Advanced Class options as characters can choose any Advanced Class within the Tech or Force playstyle! Play as a Trooper wielding a Sniper Rifle, or a Sith Inquisitor with a lightsaber in each hand, or even secretly use Dark Side powers while posing as a member of the Jedi Order.


Explore numerous planets. Hoth, Tatooine, Alderaan, and over 20 other unique and vibrant planets offer exciting exploration and thrilling adventures around every corner!


Multiplayer gameplay. Gather your allies to face challenging encounters against enemy bosses in Flashpoints and Operations, or battle against other players in Player vs. Player Warzones, Arenas, or Galactic Starfighter missions!


Galactic Strongholds Want to take a break from the inter-galactic traveling and adventure? Kick back and relax with our player housing system called Galactic Strongholds! Whether it’s overlooking the sandy dunes of Tatooine, the bright cityscape of Nar Shaddaa, or the tranquil mountains of Alderaan, there’s a Stronghold for everyone. These destinations and more are available for your galactic homestead!


Cartel Market. Only the slickest items can make their way to the Cartel Market, the premium marketplace for the galaxy’s most sought-after commodities. Players wishing to buy things here will need to purchase in-game currency called Cartel Coins. Learn more about what Cartel Coins can unlock on our Cartel Coins Page.


Subscriber Benefits. STAR WARS: The Old Republic offers an optional subscription that allows you to experience even more of the STAR WARS universe. Benefits include an increased level cap of 80 and access to the most recent expansions: Legacy of the Sith, Onslaught, Knights of the Eternal Throne, and Knights of the Fallen Empire. In addition, you will receive a monthly Cartel Coin Grant, increased XP, and more. Details on Subscriber Benefits can be found on our Subscriber Page.

applist.name: Warframe
applist.detailed_description:
New DLC Available


About the Game

Confront warring factions throughout a sprawling interplanetary system as you follow the guidance of the mysterious Lotus and level up your Warframe, build an Arsenal of destructive firepower, and realize your true potential across massive open worlds in this thrilling, genre-defining third-person combat experience.

BECOME A POWERFUL WARRIOR

Enter your Warframe: a bio-metal suit of untold power. Unleash its Abilities and wield a vast array of devastating weaponry to effortlessly annihilate hordes of enemies on sight. And when the slaughter is over, you can earn or instantly unlock 40+ different Warframes - each with a unique suite of powers - to re-experience the mayhem any way you want.

BATTLE ALONGSIDE FRIENDS

Form a Squad with your friends and earn valuable bonus Rewards when you complete Missions together via highly collaborative, co-op gameplay. Utilize your Warframe’s Abilities to heal allies, redirect enemy fire, and achieve your objectives. Stuck on a particular challenge? In-game matchmaking makes it easy to connect with friendly Tenno whenever you need an extra hand.

EXPLORE A MASSIVE SYSTEM

Deftly maneuver through ground-based Missions with your Warframe’s mesmerizing parkour skills, or take to the stars and engage in massive ship-to-ship battles in your very own customizable spacecraft. Lose yourself within mysterious open-world landscapes and discover a system teeming with fascinating lifeforms - both friendly and hostile.

DISCOVER AN EPIC STORY

Marvel at the sweeping history of the Origin System as you experience Warframe’s massive cinematic narrative spanning 5 separate expansions and 30+ story-based Quests. Discover the power within and experience your first taste of invincibility with one of three original Warframes before you begin your journey, develop your skills and seek out the truth behind your awakening.

MASTER YOUR ARSENAL

Your starter Weapons are just the beginning. Craft hundreds of destructive armaments, plus vehicles, Companions and more. Level them up and experiment until you find the right combination of gear that suits your unique playstyle. Fashion your weaponry for a fearsome look to compliment your custom-designed loadout.

CUSTOMIZE ENDLESSLY

Entering the Origin System means joining legions of friendly Tenno, each with their own personalized Warframes, Weapons and gear. With a staggering number of Customization options available to enhance your Loadout, designing the perfect look for your Warframe makes for an endlessly rewarding challenge for you and your Squad.
applist.about_the_game:
Confront warring factions throughout a sprawling interplanetary system as you follow the guidance of the mysterious Lotus and level up your Warframe, build an Arsenal of destructive firepower, and realize your true potential across massive open worlds in this thrilling, genre-defining third-person combat experience.

BECOME A POWERFUL WARRIOR

Enter your Warframe: a bio-metal suit of untold power. Unleash its Abilities and wield a vast array of devastating weaponry to effortlessly annihilate hordes of enemies on sight. And when the slaughter is over, you can earn or instantly unlock 40+ different Warframes - each with a unique suite of powers - to re-experience the mayhem any way you want.

BATTLE ALONGSIDE FRIENDS

Form a Squad with your friends and earn valuable bonus Rewards when you complete Missions together via highly collaborative, co-op gameplay. Utilize your Warframe’s Abilities to heal allies, redirect enemy fire, and achieve your objectives. Stuck on a particular challenge? In-game matchmaking makes it easy to connect with friendly Tenno whenever you need an extra hand.

EXPLORE A MASSIVE SYSTEM

Deftly maneuver through ground-based Missions with your Warframe’s mesmerizing parkour skills, or take to the stars and engage in massive ship-to-ship battles in your very own customizable spacecraft. Lose yourself within mysterious open-world landscapes and discover a system teeming with fascinating lifeforms - both friendly and hostile.

Level them up and experiment until you find the right combination of gear that suits your unique playstyle. Fashion your weaponry for a fearsome look to compliment your custom-designed loadout.
